It wasn't an overnight trip so we only used the hotel room for a shower and a quick nap. Please note that the mud bath is very hot and you do not have to put your whole body inside. There is a bit of a smell and feels yucky and weird at first but you get used to it. Not really sure how they clean the mudbath or if the heat kills any germs other people leave behind. You don't bring a bathing suit at the spa since you are naked throughout - of course they provide a robe for you to put on when you go in between rooms. There's cold water with lemon in all the rooms since you need to hydrate yourself. My husband thought it was relaxing - he fell asleep on both the mud bath and the blanket wrap. It didn't feel like we were there long enough for me to doze off. My friends, somehow got lucky and they were upgraded to a room with an adjoining room - we paid the same amount, but again we didn't spend the night so they didn't really get to take advantage of the room. The rooms are clean but basically motel room quality. It was a great, neat experience for an awesome deal. I wish the mud bath and blanket wrap was a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven Hot Springs - Mud Bath”
Reviews.Author: clpayne
Reviews.Content: We recently did the Couples Mud Bath at the Golden Haven Hot Springs in Calistoga. This was a fun and unique experience. It is 1 hr - approx 10 min in the HOT mud, rinse off, 10 - 15 min in the mineral springs hot tub and 20 min in the thermal wrap. We did not do a massage. We paid $85 total. On their web site they offer last minute specials. Highly recommend watching for these deals. The specials are often listed a week or more in advance. I believe regular price is $170. Don't know that it was worth that much, but for $85 we felt it was a very good value. Not something we would do again, but something we are very glad we experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: aaronsangel
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this spa. We went for our 19th wedding anniversary. I scheduled a mud bath, whirlpool, massage and finally a bed! It was better than we remembered! It was so relaxing and enjoyable. It is worth the effort to find this out of the way spot. Make sure you book a late appointment, you are so relaxed all you want to do is go back to your room and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Skip It”
Reviews.Author: sdtraveler417
Reviews.Content: Wow - not what we expected! I decided to plan a spa day for my husband and I while we were in Napa (he had never been) and we chose the mud bath based on reviews on here and from friends. We drove up and my husband said "this can't be right"...referring to the motel look from the road. I was also shocked but said I was sure it would be better inside. This was not the case. It is not your typical spa, which may be fine for some people. They check you in like you are checking in to a motel. We were taken back to our mud room and the first thing we noticed was the overwhelming smell of the mud, it was foul! We are told to undress and how to climb in to the mud so we don't burn ourselves. The only thing we could think of was how many other people had been in here before us. Not a pleasant thought. We gamely went forward though. The mud was thick, chunky and hot. After sitting in there for about 10 minutes we were told it was time to shower. The shower is a old curtained off area with 1 shower head and 1 hose. While you are showering, the staff person is hosing down the mud in the room. Very strange. After showering it's time to go in the jacuzzi which looked old and not very clean. We stayed there for about 10 minutes and were told to put our robes on and come out to the cooling area. The robes were old, mismatched and very thread bare. They don't provide flip flops so we walked around bare foot trying not to think about what we were walking on. The cooling off consisted of 1 thin blanket, followed by a itchy wool blanket with the light dimmed. We were there for 25 minutes. Again, odd. And the walls are paper thin and you hear everything else that is going on outside. The minute we were out of the mud room, a new couple was escorted in. We had "upgraded" to a 1/2 hour massage, and this was also disappointing. My husbands' masseuse talked the whole time, the lights were on and it wasn't very romantic at all. Plus the woman I had hurt my shoulders so much I thought I might have to get another massage at home to correct what she had done/not done. Last step was a "shower room" which had a tiny shower, no garbage can, no fan and 1 tiny stool. The shower had industrial shampoo and conditioner. We quickly showered and raced out of there, ignoring the dirty q-tip on the floor. There was also no where to put the robes or towels, so they went on the floor. Overall, very disappointing but I guess you pay for what you get. This was by no means cheap, but also not the traditional spa pricing either. It was an experience that neither my husband or I will forget or repeat, at least not here. 1 positive - the staff was all nice but it didn't make up for the dinginess of the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Getting dirty is not only so much fun, but so relaxing as well!”
Reviews.Author: tahaus
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven Hot Springs and Spa was a wonderful experience. No place, have I ever seen, offered mud baths before. It's a wonderful and awesome experience. The hot mud makes your muscles feel so relaxed and sweats out all the toxins in your skin. The entire spa treatment was just wonderful including the treatment specialist. Papering at a new level of dirtiness.

Reviews.Title: “a truly relaxed & wonderful experience in the hands of professionalism”
Reviews.Author: ladyjanefiji
Reviews.Content: my girlfriends went to golden haven to celebrate rey's ( a breast cancer survivor) birthday & were greeted with warm smiles & an air of calm professionalism. our room was very clean with beds & beddings very comfortable. we had such a wonderful time with the mud & hot springs bath, massage & herbal facial.....giggling our way through the whole experience.....the staff so accomodating & friendly! we will be recommending golden haven hot springs spa to all our friends & relatives.....a few of whom have already indicated a willingness to try golden havesn hot springs spa in the near future. already my friends and I have made plans to visit whenever we feel we need relaxation. the mud, mustard & music festival will be a yearly thing for us from now on. woohoo to barry & the wonderful staff at golden haven hot springs spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “A PLEASANT MEMORABLE EXPERIENCE...YOU HAVE TO GO”
Reviews.Author: Getting-outta-here
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Staff is VERY welcoming. Hope it always stays that way. On the way in I saw many spa choices, but take no interest in them now because our room, the service and friendliness of staff members, definitely sold us. It was our first spa experience and "Bobby" made us very comfortable. It was clean and the ambiance walking through your resort was terrific. Guests were so relaxed there it left us all comfortable with each other and "hellos" were exchanged. As soon as we can get away from the Bay Area, we will definitely be back. I'm at my desk right now missing it much, but at least I can visit you for now in my mind as a memorable experience. David & Debbie Nunu

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a Surprise! Chris & Dana”
Reviews.Author: 50PlusCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The end of fall so we were getting warm days. Hadn't been away for nearly a year so very ready to relax and have fun, which we did! Got internet special so mud baths for first time in our lives. Was fabulous. I have trouble with humidity (breathing) but Rebecca was a calming factor and once I relaxed I was fine. Chris was skeptical about mud baths but found it therapeutic and will go back. Liked the hoses w/spray nozzles to wash each other off after the mud bath - then slipped into our own little mineral hot tub and after that we were wrapped on massage tables and put to sleep for 20 min. By the way the mud's earthy smell was an important part of the experience and welcome. Our hotel room was really quite nice, comfortable, modern yet cozy...just the right balance. We had a couple easy chairs (tres chic!) and we had a kitchenette which we used. Little chairs and tables outside our French doors - we used that too...had cockatils in evening and read paper/drank coffee in morning. Pool was great, hot tubs great (don't wear your silver into the hot tubs as they will tarnish), grounds were just so pretty, clean and well kept. Very peaceful and relaxing. Brought our bicycles along so did the Silverado trail to St. Helena then grabbed the muni there to go back. We realized that it probably wasn't the best idea to do the trip to St. Helena after the mud baths because by the time we got there we were feeling like noodles :-) ....next time do the ride round trip then do the mud bath after! You can walk into town from here. We will be back! P.S. It would be nice if noise in hallway of massage areas was quieter ....like whisper or low voice quiet......

Reviews.Title: “One of the most amazing experiences of my life...”
Reviews.Author: si1lypetah
Reviews.Content: When you enter the place, it looks somewhat old, but don't even worry because inside the facility and the rooms, it's like a completely different place. The rooms look AMAZING. huge beds, new carpet, huge room, mini kitchen... this place knows detail. They even leave you plates and utensils in case you brought a little something something for a meal (we did, and we overlooked bringing plates/forks/etc). I didn't hear any of my neighbors, so that was cool. We got the spa getaway which includes an overnight stay, mud bath, mineral spa, and european wrap. I have never done any of these before, so it was cool. Alma, the lady that helped us, was amazing. She made my experience much more pleasant and I felt comfortable. Mud bath was AMAZING. mineral spa was cool, just a little cloudy. European wrap was so relaxing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. I forgot to mention, the facility was so beautiful. I would go again. My experience really was that special, no joke. PS, I'm a 26 year old dude. Suggestions: Bring a bottle opener for wine.. I forgot mine like a loser, but they had some at the office. Bring swimwear because they have a huge swimming pool of mineral water. I failed to bring mine like a loser. Bring flip flops because it's just easier when you're getting your treatments. This place seems to have a lot of deals and specials.. so take advantage of their website. No joke, I miss that place so badly haha

Reviews.Title: “Three Generation Travel”
Reviews.Author: travelswithson
Reviews.Content: Went on an overnight getaway with my parents and my two year old son. My son loves to swim, and this was the perfect place. The indoor mineral pool was perfect for my son while the two hot springs jacuzzi were perfect for my parents. It was a quiet getaway, exactly what we were looking for. Only negative was the bed. It was very uncomfortable. Other than that, the rooms, since we booked the superior room with two beds, were VERY clean. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the room. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “good value for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AntonellinaUk
Reviews.Content: the hotel and spa is off the main street of Calistoga which is a lovely small town in the heart of Napa Valley, the staff at the hotel were great and very helpful especially when it came to reccomend places to go for food or good wines to buy... the rooms are all cottage/ motel style rooms, very spacious with a small kitchenette, dressing table and a tiny but functional bathroom. As per the spa - mud bath - experience it was fun! if you are looking for 5 star facilities maybe you are coming to the wrong place as the rooms and pools are basic spartane but still very clean with aromatic candles, plenty of water needed for recovering after the treatment - the muds and the hot water are pretty smelly, well, due to their nature. We stayed there only for one night but i would have loved to stop there for longer especially as the area is so beautiful...

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jazzmasterj2000
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit here and all I can say is their staff along with our personal attendants Bobby, Ellen and Rosie are top notch. The mud bath is so relaxing that you don't want to come out. The rooms are clean and the bed is soft just what the doctor ordered after a good massage. This is a place I will definitely come back to on my next visit to Calistoga and the Napa Valley. Also as an overnight guest you get 10-20% discounts at select wineries so do take advantage of this additional perk.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasurable Experiance”
Reviews.Author: cemoosemama
Reviews.Content: This past weekend we decided to escape down to Calistoga to partake in our very FIRST Mud Bath experiance. After checking the reviews over the internet I decided to make our reservations at The Golden Havens Spa & Resort. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a very friendly and efficient staff. We opted for the Jacuzzi Room so we'd get to enjoy the jacuzzi at our leisure. The room was emaculate with alot of nice, extra touches, including our favorite bottle water, Crystal Geyser. Our Spa treatment was scheduled for the following day, which included the Mud Bath, jacuzzi, cool down wrap to restore your body temperature back to normal before becoming enveloped in a much needed massage, orchestrated by two very professional masseuses, Ed and Rebecca. Over the years we've become veterans of massages and we both agreed these were the most OUTSTANDING massages that we've ever received. Many thanks to both Ed and Rebecca. After experiancing our FIRST Mud Bath we were both very pleased by its healing and rejuvenating properties. Although getting out was much more difficult than rolling in. Sergio was very attentive during this portion of the treatment and was very thorough explaining each step. All in all our visit to The Golden Haven Spa & Resort was very pleasant and we will surely be returning in the near future. Many thanks once again to Barry and his wonderful staff for making this such a wonderful and memorable experiance. Mr. & Mrs. Gerald Baggs Redding, CA

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: spulis20
Reviews.Content: So the rooms where ok, not the niccest, but good for the price. My mine reason for going was for the spa treatment. Trust me when I say that the spa looks nothing like the pictures. It looks very run down on the inside and they give you a rough polyester robe to wear during your treatments. I tried to do the mud bath, but it was so stuffy and the room smelt bad. I couldnt even do the mud bath, The mud bath room looks nothing like the picture that they show on their site. but had to pay for it anyways. so yes skip the mud bath if you go there. the message was nice. i wanted to relax, but it was so hard, because the employees where in the hallway laughing and joking with each other. i would go back to stay the night, because the rooms weren't all that bad, but heck no on the spa, big waset of money.

Reviews.Title: “Gettin' Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: GigEm99
Reviews.Content: We booked the mudbath and massage here for a gilrs weekend to Wine country. The hotel is very 70's, but seemed clean enough. We got an internet special mudbath treatment and hour long massage for 140.00- look for it, but print the coupon. Otherwise they will charge reg price. Read the reviews of the mudbath, we found it fun and different. The massage was about average, but a good value for the money. I would recommend this place, just know you're not going to a $400 place.

Reviews.Title: “You can teach an old dog new tricks”
Reviews.Author: malex1960
Reviews.Content: At 49, I was a little leery of sitting in mud. I mean all my life I was told to keep mud off and stay clean, but after my visit I have a whole different outlook about mud. After the mud bath, massage and facial, I felt just wonderful. I was even able to sleep without taking my pain medication for my back. I haven't done that in 15 years! I can't wait to return again next year! Thank you Golden Haven for giving me my youth back!

Reviews.Title: “Rude- non customer oriented, in the wrong business”
Reviews.Author: lfourk
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation to the Spa and Lodgin 2 days before arrival. The operator was polite, but did not volunteer any more information that I already know or had to specifically ask. Which is fine. Since the place was running a spa treatment special, I made a reservarion for the treatment for myself and my husband for 6 p.m. on the night of arrival. However on the day of arrival we were coming back from the tour of the Napa valley and were running late to the treatment. At 6 p.m. exaclty as we got into our car ( from the tour bus, where we had no telephone numbers), I dialed the place trying to tell them that we will be 10 mintues late. After being on hold for the same 10 minutes, I was rudely informed that it is after6 p.m and we will not get the treatement, because other people are booked after us. I suggested to shrten the treatment time for us, but it was not acceptble. With my phone still in my hand I waled into the reception area at 6:12 p.m. and was flatly refused the treatment. Moreover, I was told that they are not interested in my business and I can go elsewhere for lodging as well. Asking for manager - I was talking to the manager - asking for the owner - he was conviniently not available. We decided not to go and look for other lodging because it was getting dark, and we were on the road all day long. The staff did not tell us how to use any other amenities that were advertised on the hotel site. If she could through the keys into my face she would have done it. When we got to the room - what a disappontment that was: a Motel-6 decor, 50-60's plumbing, shower that barely sprinkles, no windows in the room, unless you want to open the shades of the entrance door that faces the parking, etc. We spent the night, but my weekend was ruined - I was looking forward to a relaxing time. Instead, I got a kick out of the door of the place that had literature all over the room how this place helps you to " leave your stress behind" - A JOKE! DO NOT BELIEVE THER ELABORATE ADVERTISEMENT - NEITHER SERVICE, NOR PLACE IS WORTH TO SPEND ANY TIME THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Girlfriend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cj1074
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went on a Friday. That evening, we did a mud-bath, had a one-hour massage, and a one-hour facial. It was absolutely wonderful. The staff there at Golden Haven Hotel were very helpful and nice. The Girlfriend Getaway Package is great ...if you book that, you get a T-shirt and a choice of facial scrub (which I got and it makes your skin feel wonderful), facial moisturizer, or facial mask to take home with you. You choose one of those 3 facial products, but you can purchase the others if you'd like. The hotel is near some great restaurants, and not far from little shops too. I didn't expect the hotel to be right in the middle of a neighborhood, which I thought was a little funny, but it was really nice and quiet. Would definetely recommend this hotel. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Really fun place, GREAT value, lots of laughter”
Reviews.Author: selkie13
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven is a lovely time. Very spacious comfy rooms, GREAT staff, and the mudbath was an experience not to be missed!! My sister and I went for her birthday and had so much fun!!! Imagine, your little sister in a tub full of hot (theraputic) mud! I have wanted to do this for years!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for its price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olachi
Reviews.Content: My partner of seven years and I decided to celebrate by taking a trip out to Calistoga.... It was quite an experience as niether one of us had ever done the mud bath. I picked Golden Haven Spas because it had the most honest sounding reviews and it sounded like a fair mix of people visited the spa. We arrived on time. The girl at the counter was not pleasant.... but we figured we need not let her ruin our experience/day. The attendant during the mudbath session was pretty good.. and the massage therapists we got did great! The blanket wrap seesion was amazing.... I felt so relaxed and I know my partner felt the same because he fell into deep sleep!! We chose not stay on the grounds so we picked the HYATT Vineyard Creek Santa Rosa.... For first timers to mud baths, I am proud to say we loved it and I think fifteen minutes of mud is adequate for anyone. We are looking forward to doing this more often... Quick Tip: If you plan on tipping the attendants, be sure to keep the bulk of the tip for your masseuse. This is a case of getting what you pay for. For individuals who seek SUPER DUPER type services, they better be willing to pay HEFTY DOLLAR price tags...

Reviews.Title: “A lot of money for a 15 minute mud bath and several showers afterward.”
Reviews.Author: elli1614
Reviews.Content: First off, my husband and I did not stay in the hotel, but only went for mud baths at the recommendation of a friend. I had made the appointment the day before, but when we got there they had us booked for the following week. After some discussion, they were able to squeeze us in early, however there was no apology for the mistake. The mud bath room was pretty filthy and they don't change the mud between people, which I find disgusting. The showers afterward involved spraying yourself down with a garden hose, which doesn't really scream "relaxation" in my book. The mineral bath was nice, but rather moldy looking. Afterward that there was a "blanket wrap" which is exactly what it sounds like and nothing more. There was a regular shower following the blanket wrap. In short, we paid a lot of money for 15 minutes in mud.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryMint
Reviews.Content: My niece and I just returned from Golden Haven and enjoyed every minute of it. It was not my first time and I noticed that they have remodeled very nicely. We stayed in a good size two room suite. It was very clean. The beds are comfy, with new-looking cotton sheets. The towels are a generous size and very absorbent. The room had a microwave, small fridge and coffee maker. There is a covered mineral pool with a sundeck upstairs. The water temp was perfect. There are also two jacuzzis that hold about six people. One is hotter than the other. The staff was kind and professional and the spa services were excellent. This is a lovely, peaceful place and I plan to return soon. Golden Haven is also reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Phuakit420
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to stay here last minute. Our room was very accommodating, we had the King with joining queen. The separate room was great for us because my mom was able to go to sleep early and we could still stay up and watch the LCD TV in the main room (no TV in joining room). The fridge and microwave were a definite plus for leftovers and milk for our mornings coffee. As for the spa my mother and I enjoyed the Mud bath for 2. I've never done this and it was an amazing experience. I caught myself laughing and having fun more than relaxing I would say. (Beware: You are naked with this person in mud, showering and in the little spa tub, it was a little weird, but if I did this with a friend it would probably be more awkward. We were unaware of this when we booked it, more for intimate couples I guess.)The only thing that could have been nicer is the pool. It was old and rundown looking. The "sundeck" was more like an elevated balcony, above and away from the pool, and there is a large metal roofing over the pool which I also thought was strange and gave the pool a grungy feel even though it was clean and was a nice temperature. The 2 hot tubs were also old looking but they worked well. The pool was important for our younger teens since they weren’t doing spa treatments. Over all a really nice place with parking right out your front door. We will probably come back again and get massages next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing get away!”
Reviews.Author: JMB9
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven was a wonderful get away. Beautiful grounds, our room was newly remodeled and very comfortable. The Spa treatment was done very well, clean and professional. Can't wait to go back. It is located in a quiet neighborhood, with an easy ten minute walk to downtown for meals.

Reviews.Title: “over price”
Reviews.Author: joyjoy09
Reviews.Content: I paid $420 for my room, bath and a 1hr massage. I did not receive the 6 step treatment that was promised along with the $420 payment for the package i desired. From my knowledge i was suppose to receive a room with a jacuzzi, a 6 part spa treatment in stead of receiving that i received a 1hr massage, a meneral bath and a room which was for a couple.thank you..Ms.Mary

Reviews.Title: “Great place, clean and comfortable with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BruceVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at Golden Haven in mid June and loved our time there. It is very quiet, located a short walk from downtown Calistoga, where there are great restaurants, wine bars and pubs serving micro brews. The rooms were clean and comfortable and staff were friendly and helpful. There is a swimming pool and 2 hot tubs, with one slightly cooler than the other. We would definitely stay there next tri.p

Reviews.Title: “Great value for mudbaths and accomodations in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: kmusall
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Golden Haven for an overnight stay and mudbath. The consistent quality of service combined with reasonable prices (and great mid-meek specials!) combine for a great experience. That is why I will recommend them to anyone and continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: nephy
Reviews.Content: I tried out the mud bath because it was the "thing to do" in Calistoga... I couldn't get away faster. They don't change the mud between treatments. I find that disgusting. It wasn't relaxing because I saw the couple that left the mud bath before we entered, and all I could think about was .. I wonder what they did in here? I didn't go expecting a five star spa, but this experience was bad. The "hot tub" after the mud bath was old and moldy. I must say that the staff was very nice. But thats where it ended. Even the robes were old and nasty. I would avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experiance!”
Reviews.Author: sadiegril
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went to gloden haven spa for our anniversary. we enjoyed the mud bath, mineral pool, and massage. it was our first time for this type of pampering and loved it so much we are already talking about when we are going back. the staff was so nice and accomidating. my husband accidently left his shorts in our room when we checked out and they called us and shipped them to us free of charge. so thankful. when we dicide to pamper ourselves again we will defiantly make a reservation at golden haven spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great little get away”
Reviews.Author: cowgirl74
Reviews.Content: My daughter from NY and I decided on the spur of the moment to take a quick trip to Calistoga. We found Golden Haven Hot Springs on the internet and were able to book a wonderful spa package for the next day. All of the staff were courteous and helpful. Smiles were not in short supply. I opted for the mud bath, jacuzzi and blanket wrap, while my daughter did the herbal jacuzzi bath and wrap. I LOVED the mud bath and the blanket wrap was very relaxing. Did I mention that we got a real steal of a deal??? They even upgraded our room from the delux room to the 2 bedroom with sauna. It's a short walk to town for dining and shopping. We had a wonderful time and will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Try the mud bath.”
Reviews.Author: cmlcampbell
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for four days. We tried the mud bath treatment and it was quite the experience. My daughter enjoyed her facial, etc. The resort is relaxed and low key. The smell of the honeysuckle was beautiful. We did the internet special and got great rates. We would have stayed longer but they were booked up for father's day week-end. Had fun exploring the Calistoge area. Will definitely return. Some of the negative ratings don't seem to reflect the resort/spa we saw. We are glad we didn't cancel our reservation. . Having just come from a stay at the Bellagio, we did have something to compare it to.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven Best Value in Calistoga?”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Golden Haven Spa for several years and always felt Golden Haven to be a relaxing and reasonable place to spend a couple nights. Instead of being a nudist resort like Harbin Hotsprings, this little Haven is for those of us who like total privacy while soaking in mineral water. There is a bathtub in the room which has mineral water, and also two jacuzzis next to the swimming pool to soak in. I always watch for the Internet specials but find that the best value is to book a room, and then have a massage only. I've tried the mudbaths, and other treatments and don't feel they relax me as much as a massage. Just spent a couple nights by myself - its a quiet, safe place for a woman to spend time. Found a couple things that were rather annoying with this visit. When I booked my massage I told the front desk gal that I wanted only half an hour massage. Instead she charged me for an hour which I decided to take - even though she said she could credit my Visa. While I wasn't upset about the mix-up, I was disappointed with my massage. The gal talked continually, did not focus on my body, used cold lotion, and did not pay attention to the areas I wanted/did not want her to work on. When I left my treatment, I felt my $85.00 was wasted. I have been very happy with the other massage therapists I've had on previous visits to Golden Haven. I also was disappointed with my room accomodations. The mattress felt like straw, and the pillows were lumpy. The airconditioner was very loud, and when I opened windows for ventilation, you could hear the other airconditioners from other units during the night. The cable was down for over an hour, and it appeared there were other problems with the cable service. My room had a small refrigerator. Remember to fill up with goodies from a store that is outside of Calistoga because the market is very expensive. There are only vending machines on the premises. Beware that the swimming pool is full of chorine and is no longer a mineral pool. Otherwise, the place is a short walk to town and is well worth a visit if you can get an Internet Special.

Reviews.Title: “No Mineral Water/Bath here - Just Clorine Water”
Reviews.Author: LeRueTraveler
Reviews.Content: Traveler beware; the reported mineral bath pool is an semi-indoor clorine pool! How disappointing - no value here for your good money spent for room & clorine pool. My girlfriend and & returned to Golden Haven Spa (GHS) after 2 yrs. Apparently, the mineral pool is no longer a mineral pool as GHS reports & advertises. Instead of smelling sulfur-like mineral pool, you have a pool the reeks clorine! Your skins smells like clorine, leaving your skin dry. No value here - just another disappointing rip-off!. We drove 220 miles roundtrip and a waste of our time and money. When we voiced our concerned with the front office staff, they could care less. We asked to speak to the Manager to no avail. If you are looking for a mineral bath pool, save your money & time, and visit another spa's in town where the mineral water is not clorine treated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Antioch_CaTraveldiva
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to calistoga and my first mud bath treatment, I was very impressed with the both. There are many places to go for spa treatments and places to stay, I chose to stay at the golden haven spa and have their mud bath treatment and was very happy that I did! My father and I took advantage of one of their midweek specials and received a one night stay in a superior one bedroom suite (#3) and 2 mud baths. The room was bright with high ceilings, beautiful interior design bedding, a skylight in the dressing area, a microwave and frig. in a small walled kitchen area (perfect for our needs). Because I was traveling with my 80 yr. old father the separate bedroom was especially nice, there was a king bed in the main room and a queen in the bedroom. I was so surprised by how much we both enjoyed the mud baths, a perfect ending to our day. We also enjoyed the enclosed pool area and took advantage of swimming before our mud baths. The hot tub spas were great too. Our whole experience at the golden haven spa was wonderful and we both will be returning for more....

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: chiyoko266
Reviews.Content: Never experiencing a Spa treatment before, the service and treatments at Golden Haven was a GREAT first time exposure to it. For anyone whose never tried a mud bath, I highly recommend doing it at least once. The staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. What made our trip better, was that we didn't have to go very far to continue our peaceful weekend. The cottages on site are quaint, cute and comfortable. We plan to definitely go back to Golden Haven.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven is Calistoga's Jewel of a Spa”
Reviews.Author: ereves
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been visiting Calistoga for fifteen years. We live in the Antioch and make the drive to Calistoga two to three times a year for spa treatments or a day of shopping and lunch. Golden Haven has always been one of our favorite spas because of the relaxed atmosphere, the great massages and freindly service. They always work very hard to accomodate our requests for massage appointments and we frequently use the pool and hot tub as part of our treatments (A big plus for us). I took our daughter recently and we both recieved the best massages we'd ever experienced. We've been hotel guests in the past, mud bath recipients and we've purchased gift certificates for freinds. Convenience, cost , setting, amenities and service keep us coming back to Golden Haven, we've returned again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask a lot of questions, and get everything in writing.”
Reviews.Author: Wearsdabeach
Reviews.Content: I had recently been the travel planner for our girlfriend's getaway (a group of 5 of us). We originally booked our trip in Goldenhaven because of the information from the website and what they told us by phone. What they don't tell you is the problem. They fail to mention that they are way off the beaten path- a long walk passed the high school and in a residential neighborhood. They also don't tell you that the Girlfriend's Getaway package that they offer may not be for everybody. They insist that the spa treatments are meant to do with your buddy. Imagine- naked in a bathtub with your best friend, couples massages, and mud baths side by side! I love my friends, but if I wanted to be naked with them all weekend, I'd go to Harbin Hot Springs. This is definitely out of our comfort zone. They said that they will not do it any other way. When one of my friends tried to book one night only, they insisted that she book 2 hours worth of spa treatments in order to stay for one night. Basically everybody pays about $350 to stay there and have treatments, even if it's only for the night. They are greedy and unreasonable. Needless to say, we're staying at Dr. Wilkinson's Spa instead. Much friendlier and nicer facility. Funky on the outside, but well kept inside. Ask a lot of questions, and get things in writing (although they never sent us a itinerary).

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, shops, restaurants and a lot of friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: an8844
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent our 3 year anniversary together at Calistoga Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa and it was well worth it. We both enjoyed the spa package and overnight stay with the jacuzzi in our room. Having experienced a mud bath for the first time I've realized how relaxing it is; my girlfriend thinks so as well. The nearby shops were great and two of the restaurants that we ate at and highly recommend were Checkers for lunch and Boskos Trattoria for dinner. Overall, it was the best anniversary that we both have celebrated and plan to stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, loved calistoga,loved tha Napa”
Reviews.Author: pauldrea
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights and pretty much got two nights for one in a room with our own spa. lovely room , nice and quiet and calistoga is lovely. we loved the Napa and this is a great place to stop. Huge room with our own mineral spa bath. very nice staff, (Barry is a prompt emailer and very fair, he altered our offer after we saw an improved one on the net. try the mud bath, very hot!

Reviews.Title: “My daughter and I eperienced a very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: NubianQn
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my 24 yr-old daughter ever experienced the mud bath/massage. She truly loved it! The hotel was exquisitely cleaned and comfortable. The staff extremely friendly and helpful. The total price for the room and spa was very affordable. It is conveniently located to all the shopping and dining areas. We really enjoyed Bosko's Italian Pizerria and Cafe Sarafornia. Our stay was even more enjoyable, we headed to Old Faithful and took a tour of a couple of wineries. We are looking forward to a return visit very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable indulgence”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeetGirl
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven isn't fancy, but it lives up to its name--it's a comfortable, restful, quiet place to spend a few days regrouping. It's a motor court-style motel, and basic rooms are large with flat-screen TVs and little kitchenettes. More homey than fancy. Same thing with the spa: the mud bath-hot tub-blanket wrap treatment was affordable and effective in a modest but clean environment. It's a ten-minute walk to town through a residential neighborhood. There are fancier places in town to stay or to spa--and perhaps higher-end treatments at local day spas--but I doubt there's a better deal for doing both in one place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hana24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weeknight and also since we've been there before for their mud bath. We loved the mud bath so we decided to try out the hotel and have another round of mud bath plus an hour long massage. When we first went there, we found it a little strange that the place is in a residential area surrounded by homes and a high school. We arrived late night ~10pm and we couldn't go to the jacuzzi since they close the pool area around 10pm. So we decided to take a bath, but the water in our bathroom wasn't warm enough. It could be because it was a cold day or because the pipes are a little old. The bathroom I found to be a bit chilly. Other than that the room was spacious and clean plus we had an extra bedroom with a queen bed which we didn't use. The area with the bed stayed warm since the wall heater was close by to the bed. Each room gets one parking spot right in front of the room. We tried out the pool area in the morning and we were 2 of the 4 people there. Swam in the pool then warmed up more in the 2 jacuzzis that they had. The mud bath and massage was very relaxing and nice. The spa attendant was very professional and if we asked for more time in the hot mineral water bath they let us stay a little longer. The mud is a neat experience. We found that when we were rinsing off the mud off of us, we couldn't get warm water...later on we realized that in the spa area if we turn it to cold we got warm water. I'm not sure if it was just that day they were having this problem. I would recommend this place, but don't expect a 4 or 5 star hotel. It's definitely a small place with it's quirks, but the people there are nice. They made sure we were taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Has a nice TV”
Reviews.Author: jhom112
Reviews.Content: When you pull in you think your pulling into a motel, definately not a spa. We stayed here for 1 night but wanted to book for 2 until we were informed that kids were not alowed on the weekends and you must book a spa treatment if you stay on the weekend. This place is very odd, no phones in the room we were told it was for our privacy, if you need an iron you have to walk to the lobby and ask for one. Also the mini fridge is not plugged in so you have to do that as well. When we were there we were told the pool was closed but we can use the other hotels pool down the street just bring our own towels and show them our room key. Just by looking at the room I could only imagine when the spa must look like, I think I'll pass on the mud bath there.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelGal
Reviews.Content: As soon as I read about the mud baths in Calistoga I knew I had to try one. My research online led me to The Golden Haven Hot Springs and I am so happy. We spent the beginning of our 2 week vacation in California in Napa and then we traveled up to Calistoga . I scheduled a mud bath and massage for after a beautiful day of wine tasting at the nearby wineries. The staff at Golden Haven were friendly and helpful as we were new to the mud bath experience. It was soooo relaxing, a little strange climbing into the mud but we loved it. Afterward we went to the pool and hot mineral spring jauzzi and relaxed some more. Our room was also extremely large and. comfortable. We loved the vanity dressing area outside from the bathroom. We walked into town and had a nice meal and some great entertainment in the form of a jazz band at the Hydroe Bar and Grill. We just loved our whole experience at The Golden Haven and Calistoga.We were sad to leave Napa Valley but we were heading up to see the Redwoods at Redwood National. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway...”
Reviews.Author: ashbury555
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Golden Haven was the perfect getaway! We did the works - mud bath and massage. The mud bath, which included time in a whirlpool tub and blanket wrap was very relaxing. This we followed with an hour massage. The masseurs were very professional we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Our room was very homey. It was complete with a microwave, refrigerator, cable tv, and internet connection. Our room also included a huge spa tub. Sitting in the warm tub, sipping a nice bottle of wine was heavenly. The king sized bed was comfortable and had plenty of fluffy pillows! If I could change anything, it would be the shower head. A nice rain type shower head would be my suggestion. I would definately recommend Golden Haven Spa to anyone visiting the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for Golden Haven Spa!”
Reviews.Author: megstarmm
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny. All we expected and more. Will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great spa hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ultimulletwarrior
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary there and booked the couples spa package, complete with mud baths. It was well worth it. I've never been so relaxed. The rooms smelled a little like sulphur, but that is to be expected since their water is heated from the springs in the area. All in all it was a great hotel, with a great spa. If you go, definitely opt to have a mud bath and massage. It will leave you feeling like a bowl of jello.

Reviews.Title: “Was shocked upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: motishere
Reviews.Content: I booked this "spa" online and was anxious to be there with my daughters. I was expecting an upscale "resort/spa" I was shocked and disappointed upon pulling into this place. It was, on first view a "motel 6" experience. It is in the middle of a street, surrounded by low income homes. Upon entering the room, you are met with a large bed, a small sink area, another room with a bed in it and NO dressers in either room. There is no air conditioning in the second room, just a table fan. So, you have to live out of your suitcase for long stays and to me that is not acceptable. There is a pool, minimally clean, two hot tubs, and a very very small "lay out" area upstairs from the pool, maybe 8 chairs. I did some spa treatments and they were very bohemian. No sinks in the massage rooms, wooden tables, noisey. I will say that it was very very quiet for sleeping. There are no food items available, no phones in the rooms, and their free coffe in the morning in on a rickity cart outside the office. I stayed for 4 days and it turned out only to be ok, after my initial shock. I would not recommend this "spa" to anyone who is actually looking to stay in a "spa/resort" If you are looking for just a motel room, this would be it.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location and hot springs”
Reviews.Author: chmorga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our anniversary by treating ourselves to 3 nights/four days at Golden Haven. When we arrived our room was ready for early check in and we went off to our "spa fling" already unpacked. This was a great experience for my guy. Our spa day was not a "girlie spa day." We enjoyed the mud bath, shower, hot mineral water jacuzzi, wrap and massage as part of the couples special advertised online. We had a mineral bath jacuzzi in our room, and the pool and hot mineral spas were just steps away. Spa staff was very accommodating, and neither of us were ever uncomfortable. The location is excellent, walking distance to town for dinner and shopping and right off the Silverado Trail for wine tasting. We went for a balloon ride across the Napa Valley, too. Staff was very helpful, and the town is fun. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spa, great staff, a must in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: lindzilla
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a "Girlfriends Special" offered on their web page and boy was it fun. We enjoyed a mudbath, blanket wrap and massages by real professionals. Customer service from the entire staff was exemplary and I believe they all wanted to be there and wanted to help! Golden Haven provided us with a list of wineries that were fantastic and many offered free tastings to people staying there. We went to some small places we would never have found such as the Frank Family Vineyard and received royal treatment! This was a wonderful stay and play vacation and I can't wait to get back there and enjoy another massage and more spa treatment!!

Reviews.Title: “Falling in Love again with nostalgic and lovely Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: bigdogCA
Reviews.Content: My wife was new to Calistoga. We had visited only once before. I remember living in Healdsburg in the early 80's and biking from Alexander Valley vineyards to this quaint spa village. I thought it was all gone by now. Not so! The Golden Haven Spa has created the ambience, serenity and healing place for the hurried 21st century soul. We had a lovely newley remodeled room with a quiet and artful interior design. HD TV and a new small refrigerator was a plus. Our time spent in the serene massage/mud bath area was charming, soulful and soothing. Our massages were perfection itself. The grounds were lovely, set back from a quiet street about four blocks from main street. The staff was friendly and recovered my expensive Italian designer sunglasses the first day - saved me $400 ! The pool and hot spas were delightful. I was in a group of mixed couples one which were newly weds. We had a blast talking in the evening about everything and anything. My wife and I walked to breakfast only to find Adam Sandler and a crew of actors chating with the small group in a nice quiet dinner. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Way to Relax!!”
Reviews.Author: laenie
Reviews.Content: First impression: Small, tidy resort of an updated older motel. Nice grounds with fountains, sunbathing on roof top, pool with covered, gated area. Cozy areas with tables, chairs, well landscaped for sitting, relaxing, sipping your wine or just chatting with others. Who went, two adults looking for a nice, quiet weekend in wine country. Was recommended by a friend to try the couple’s mud baths. We spent two nights of quiet and restful sleep. Room: #24, King bed with in room Jacuzzi. Nice sized room, large, comfy bed with lots of pillows, two comfy chairs with a table, fridge and nice sized bathroom. The windows all opened for fresh air, and the air conditioner worked nicely, although was slightly noisy. The room had a wonderful smell of lemons and other spices, which actually was also the smell we had in the spa. I ended up buying some of the bath salts and now they sit on my tub at home to remind us of the wonderful time we had. The entire resort was very clean, we saw people walking around checking the grounds frequently! Mud baths: we had a wonderful time. I must say I was a little apprehensive when I saw the baths and the mud as it looked a little daunting. But our spa person, Kim, was wonderful, and explained everything to us. Here’s how it goes: you arrive and check in at the spa, which is in the back of the resort. Everyone was super friendly, asking if we’d been there before, (we hadn’t) and giving us any information we needed. There is fresh chilled lemon water available and the entire spa smells of lemons!! We were called for our time (8pm) and Kim took us into the main mud bath area, which also had the showers and our Jacuzzi mineral bath. She leaves you after explaining what to do and we are left to disrobe and enter the mud. My husband and I were laughing the entire time as it is quite an experience to squish yourself into the mud. You slide onto the top then kind of wriggle down, it is quite warm and you then scoop the mud on top of yourself, what a sensation. Very warm but not uncomfortable!! Kim knocks and after we say ok, she enters, and explains we will be in the bath for 15 mins, she gives us each a cup of ice water, covers our face with a cooling mask and puts a washcloth on our head. We were in for a very relaxing 15 mins and were surprised how quickly it went. Then we are told to head into the shower and we had a great time hosing each other off (in private of course!!). As we are taking our shower Kim prepared our Jacuzzi bath and left us to sink ourselves into more, luxurious relaxation. We are given salts to sprinkle into the water if we wanted, and we did, after relaxing for quite awhile. Too soon a knock comes and we are told to put our robes on (provided by the spa) and follow Kim to the blanket room where we are wrapped in soft, felt and then wool blankets. There we are left with a cool washcloth to our foreheads to listen to wonderful soothing music as we finish our soothing hour at the spa!! The Golden Haven was easy to find, in a great location within walking distance to downtown Calistoga. There it is a quant little town with little boutique stores and some very nice restaurants and bars. I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting/needing a little getaway in wine country!

Reviews.Title: “best deal in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: 80rice
Reviews.Content: Are you considering staying at the Golden Haven? Here is what my wife and I observed for the first time visiting the Golden Haven resort. The front desk customer service was above average. I loved the atmosphere and cleanliness of the property and rooms. The rooms were well remodeled with a sleek style and immaculately clean and freshly scented. I loved the fact that the spring water was available in the bathroom showers. The swimming pool and Jacuzzi were also clean and remained at a comfortable temperature. A friendly attendant would come and knock at your door fifteen minutes prior; to escort you to your mud bath/massage appointments. The staff members were very helpful and respectful at all times. One suggestion is that in the future the resort should consider a 24 hour Deli, Restaurant, or Snack Shack for the resort guests. It would also be nice if there was a game room with video games, fuse ball, ping pong or pool tables. A soundproof entertainment room of course, so that the guest will not be distracted or disrupted by the noise; but to be at peace and quiet environment. I highly recommend this resort to all people. The Golden Haven is a heavenly place of piece of quiet, great mud baths and body massages for an affordable price. I will recommend this resort to my family and friends. I’m actually looking forward to visiting again. This is the best deal in Calistoga! Respectfully, Cesar

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and relaxed at Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: beachfox
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Golden Haven recently to celebrate our 30th birthdays. We stayed only one night, it was an easy drive up from the city. Our room was a decent size (1 king and 1 queen bed), clean with simple décor. The girlfriend’s spa special was fantastic and included a mud bath, mineral Jacuzzi and blanket wrap plus a message and facial. I recommend upgrading the message and facial to a full hour each for an extra $60. It was a full 3 hours of pampering and relaxation. The spa staff was friendly and professional. My only complaint would be the upstairs showers/dressing rooms are VERY small and you have to walk outside in your robe and wet hair. We had a wonderful dinner at All Seasons Bistro and a friendly, small-town breakfast at Sarafornia Diner both on Lincoln Ave in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Mother daughter trip-Great!”
Reviews.Author: chuyllu
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this property last summer (July 2007). It was really great. The "girlfriends package" was worth it. The mudbath was odd but fun and detoxifying. The beds and rooms were by far the most comfortable we slept on during our entire trip (half the trip was in a motel in napa). You have to let the water run a long time to get "hot water" for the shower, but no big deal. The night before our mudbath, we were in the hottub. A local was there (they let locals use the pool/hottub for a small fee). She was very positive about the business and would regularly get a mudbath and massage herself. This was very encouraging and she wasn't wrong.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Phoenix, AZ by way of Sonoma County, CA
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: Erica3232
Reviews.Content: This is my third time returning to Golden Haven, although it was my first time to actually stay overnight. Everything was wonderful each time, very consistent service. My boyfriend and I upgraded to a spa room and loved it! To be honest our expectations were exceeded when it came to the over all appearance and quality of the room. One thing I liked the person who helped us last time (Nov 06) was the same one to help us this time. It says a lot for the place if even the employees are staying. I am sure he (Jordan) didnt recognize us from the next person but its always great to see a familiar face. Go here you will not be dissappointed =)

Reviews.Title: “You have to go!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleandKyle
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit skeptical...however, this was a great place!! The pros: Friendly staff, quick check-in, was able to book a mud bath at the last minute, we had the cheapest room and it was still large and luxurious - included a mini-fridge, candies, and everything was very clean and new. New flatscreen TV on the wall. For $98 per night, seriously, how can you beat it??? We did a couples mud bath and it was awesome!!! Lying in the mud was very relaxing and our attendant was very caring and even gave us some extra time in the bath and in the jacuzzi. It's a very romantic experience although the facilities could use a little dressing up - it's a bit hospital-like with the tile and no real decorations. Again, for an hour and 15 min spa treatment for about $50 per person, how can you beat it?? The cons: Bed was so-so in terms of linens and comfort, parking was far from our room and we had to climb steps with our luggage. Definitely go here and enjoy - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Boyfriend's Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tishr19
Reviews.Content: I heard about Golden Haven on the radio (KGO) . My boyfriend's (John) birthday was coming up and I was trying to figure out where to take him and I went to their website and I knew this was it. He is a licensed massage therapist but has no one to give him a massage, so I knew this was perfect for him. (and me!) I booked the on-line special for couples spa/room combo and we had a fabulous time! Our guide (Jimmy) was great, very personable and friendly, helped every step of the way which was great because we were new at this. We did the mud bath/mineral jacuzzi/ towel wrap combo. All fabulous and made our skin so soft. Then off to a 1 hr. massage. I had Ed, John had a man named Paul and they were quite good at their craft. John was very pleased with his massage and he knows a good one when he gets it. When we were done we went to dinner at a great Italian restauraunt called Bosco's. When we got back we went to the pool area and sat in both hot tubs and visited with other guests. Our room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had a wonderful time! We felt great and take with us great memories of our first spa experience. We want to go back for the European Spa Wrap next.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: benscik
Reviews.Content: This place is just fantastic! From the point of making a last minute reservation to our departure they were there to help. Very polite, curtious and informative about the area. The resort is above par in its cleanliness. The room we stayed in was just remodeled. I can not say enough about this room. It was beautifully done. From the paint to the new tile in the bath room. Unbelievable room. Even had HD Flat Screen TV! I believe they have completed the remodel of all the rooms at this point. The spa treatment was good. My wife and I had the 1 hour total massage. Very relaxing. The pool and spa are enclosed so the winter stay was dry. They have a large heated mineral pool and (2) hot tubes. One is mineral and the other is standard water I believe. Again a very clean area. Overall I would highly recommend a stay here. The only draw back I saw was that they needed a nice garden setting. But that is it. Very nice stay thanks to all that helped us out during our visit. Ed & Eileen from San Ramon, CA

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: tms61073
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend planned a secret post-Valentine weekend getaway. I had no expectations since I didn't know the plan until we arrived. Upon arrival, and learning that we had a room nearest the road, he asked for a room farthest from the road since I'm a light sleeper. They moved us to Room 2, which was huge, and actually had 2 bedrooms. They also changed our mud bath time since we arrived late, without hassle! The mud bath was a 1st for us both, and EXTREMELY relaxing once you get past the Eww! factor of squishing into mud. Everything was perfect - our "helper" (for lack of better word), Tony (I think), was very attentive! He told us the plan, gave us privacy, always knocked AND awaited an ok before entering, and made sure our experience was positive. -- We decided to book appts the next morning too. I had a 1-hour massage with Rebecca, which was amazing, and probably one of the best massages I've ever had. She really listened and focused on my problem areas. I'll definitely be back to visit her in the future, preferably with a 90 minute massage following a mud bath... And I'm NOT a "spa person" but this was GREAT! My boyfriend had a 1/2 hour foot reflexology and enjoyed it as well. He said next time he'll add an add'l 1/2 hour foot massage to the foot reflexology. -- The room was very clean, quiet, comfortable, quality linens, and table/chairs outside our door on the patio to enjoy the afternoon sun. -- The pool and 2 jacuzzis were equally enjoyable. A VERY POSITIVE experience, and I'll definitely be back when I need more relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: dkumetat
Reviews.Content: I had booked a stay as a Christmas present for my wife daughter and mother. They were absolutely thrilled with there experience, so I booked a stay and spa treatment for my wife and I for her birthday. The massage and mud bath were fantastic, although I actually was quite partial to the blanket wrap after the mud bath. The room was very clean and a perfectly nice place to spend a romantic weekend with a loved one. The hot tub in our room was more than large enough for two and the supply of hot mineral water was endless. Couple this with the location and the endless supply of world class wines, food and extremely professional staff . It is a winner!!!!! Already booking another trip for early spring.. D Kumetat

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rejuvenation”
Reviews.Author: NanaPops
Reviews.Content: Our post holi-daze, post tax prep., chance to relax and renew led us to Golden Haven. They have great online deals, a covered pool and spa, so rainy winter weather doesn't interfere with swimming and soaking and we were able to get wonderful relaxing spa treatments for both of us together (coed!) without having to leave the premises. We love the mud baths! If soaking in that peat/mud brew doesn't relax you to the bones I don't know what will. And to follow that with an hour massage... Perfect. We were blissed and completely renewed compared to the shape we were in when we arrived. The rooms are lovely. Even though it is an older place, it has been remodeled recently and the rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. AND without being downtown, it is still easily within walking distance of everything. It only took a few minutes to walk to a restaurant or the stores. Works for us. We had a completely rejuvenating and pleasurable mini-vacation.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaGemini
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Golden Haven for many years, but then eight years went by while we were busy having kids. We just returned from a weekend there after our long hiatus, and were delighted to find the rooms and spa nicely updated. The Golden Haven folks still offer the terrific services and friendliness and relaxation we have always enjoyed there in the past. And we love the fact that the spa is tucked away in a quiet, residential neighborhood (walking distance from town), which adds to the peaceful environment. Golden Haven remains our favorite place to stay and get pampered in Calistoga!

Reviews.Title: “It was relaxing though the smell was bad...”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlove13
Reviews.Content: So after booking my Weekend stay and mudbath with Golden Haven.. I read reviews and read really bad ones!! I expected the worst, but it turned out great!! Though the mud baths are on the very hot side.. it was an experience!! Though the water may smell bc of the showers and the water pressure that keeps changing really suck.. Everything was clean and neat... though they shld consider air freshners or something that can help the smell at least.. They also have a heated pool which is great and two jacuzzi, which consist of mineral water and one city water.. Overall it was a nice stay... Though the smell kind of drove me away.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome time at Golden Haven Hot springs”
Reviews.Author: chryssieG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn Wed and Thurs night. Very clean comfortable rooms with a huge bed and a mineral water spa in the room. We had the couples mud bath and massage special at the spa which is in the same location. Every one on staff was pleasant and helpful. We had a wonderful time and will most definately do this again! Great price Great service and a great time!!! Dale and Christine

Reviews.Title: “A piece of Havven”
Reviews.Author: Sylviaanguiano
Reviews.Content: Calistoga, CA: Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa. Date: December 16, 2007. Reviewer: Redwood City, CA I was so impressed with the service and the cleaness of the hotel. My husband and I had the couple mud bath. my husband was stepical about doing it, but i read the reviews on AAA, catalog and told him about, so we went and he was impress with the service and the atmosfere was so relaxing. that he recomended to our family and friends. I was vere suprised about their facials and had many in the past but like at the spa Never!!! The lady was so kind and polite. She explain each procedure and was impress that they only use herbs, fruit, otmeal. my face never been so young and fresh looking after athe facial. They do not pok your face everything is masks and massages. I recomend to everyone to go there and you will want to again for treatments only at Golden Haven. Like the name says it is haven!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: farmerett
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful spa treatment and our room was very comfortable too. But I feel we were ripped off price-wise. They advertise their package prices but in fact it is just as expensive to book a package as it is to book your room and your spa treatments separately. Plus by booking a package deal, they don't let you have the benefit of AAA or AARP discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Spa Resort”
Reviews.Author: MHank
Reviews.Content: I must agree with some of the other guests that have reviewed this place. My fiance and I just returned from the Napa Valley and stayed at this "spa" for one night of our trip. He booked this as a surprise to me as he had read some wonderful reviews about it on other websites. When we pulled up we were very disappointed as well. It is very outdated and dingy. He got us the room with the hot tub, which was not used during this stay. The linens appeared dirty and the bathroom was disgusting. We had the mud bath, body wrap as well. This was my first mud bath. I was excited about it at first, but after I got in all my thoughts went to who else had been in this same tub of mud, how often it is reused, etc. and I could not really enjoy it. As we showered off behind a curtain that did not close, our attendant was also in the room hosing down the floor--not very private. She also came in while we were in the hot tub, naked... We were then taken to a room with two tables that we laid on and were covered by one wool blanket. Not what I was expecting for a "wrap". All in all, I would not go back to this resort or recommend it to anyone, not even if the price is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Home Base”
Reviews.Author: tlpumpkin
Reviews.Content: Given that the prices at the Golden Haven are so much cheaper than everywhere else, I have to admit I was a little wary about what we would find. But honestly, it was exactly what we were looking for and then some. A simple home base from which we could head out in the morning to go exploring wineries all across the Napa and Sonoma Valleys, then roll back to in the evening for a quick dip in the pool, a relaxing soak in the hot tub and a night of quiet slumber in our room. Each day our room was replenished with two FREE water bottles (something hotels 4X the price don't do). There was a small fridge for keeping our cheese and assorted goodies. And the mud bath was the icing on the cake. We liked it so much, we went back for seconds a few days later. Another place around the corner offers similar prices but the rooms did not have private bathrooms, which is why in the end we opted for the Golden Haven and we are forever glad we did. Stay here and spend the money you save eating and drinking at Napa's world class restuarants. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: wattbenjamin
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this charming retreat and were thoroughly impressed with everything. A great location close to the action in town, a super charming room and comfortable bed, a great spa (highly recommend the couples mud bath) and a very helpful and friendly staff. We will definitely visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Comfort & Relaxation @ Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: SassyMamaKim
Reviews.Content: I'm 45, going through a divorce after 30 years of marriage & have 2 daughters aged 5 & 3 years. This was the best place for me to be by myself for 3 days during the final stage of my divorce. Not only was my room clean, cozy & comfortable, but the entire staff was very accommodating, friendly and courteous. What a super hideaway it was- hot spring tubs, pool, spa services and a wonderful area to take a walk & feel safe while being alone! Town is a short distance away with plenty of shops, as well as wonderful restaurants with just about any kind of food to suit your mood & palate! My favorite was Checkers for a half order each of the greek salad & raviolis, which was just right! I even went wine tasting & received a 10% discount on wines purchased with a special wine tour flyer the Golden Haven provided. The housekeeping & office staff even went out of their way to help me get back a personal item I left in my room upon checkout! I highly recommend the Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa to anyone & will be returning myself as soon as possible!!! Maybe even with someone special... Submitted by Kim L. Meyer, Grass Valley, CA

Reviews.Title: “An anniverary to remember!!!”
Reviews.Author: uncdeezyy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa in Calistoga, CA. The whole atmosphere of was just relaxing. Our room was spectacular with the jacuzzi in the bedroom. We definately recommend getting a jacuzzi room. All the nightlife and restaurants were just a few miles away. That was a real plus to us. We scheduled a mud bath, massage and a facial for the following day. All three are must haves when you visit this spa. The entire staff was very pleasant and quick to offer a helping hand when one was needed. They made this anniversary for my wife and I, definately one to remember. We will without a doubt return to Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and be pampered”
Reviews.Author: scully-antelope
Reviews.Content: On our recent stay to Calistoga, Ca, we truly enjoyed our two night stay at the Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa. With their large 80 degree pool, hot tub and lesser degree tub, we felt right at home. Having been pampered by the entire staff, including our mud bath/mineral bath, blanket wrap and topping it all off with a massage, it was one of the most relaxing times we have shared for a weekend getaway. The room that we stayed in was large and comfortable. Of coarse, there are all of the attractions to visit too. Like Old Faithful, The Petrified Forest and the many wonderful places within walking distance to dine at. Of coarse, I can't leave out all of the beautiful wineries to visit. I personally give this place a thumbs up to all who visit. Sincerely, Mark and Karen D.

Reviews.Title: “The Mud Bath Getaway”
Reviews.Author: virgOgirl13
Reviews.Content: I wen to Golden Haven with my niece for her birthday. It was our first experiance for a mud bath and we were really looking forward to being pampered. We booked the girlfriends special but upgrated it to an hour facial and massage after the mud bath. It was everything we anticipated and more. We stayed just one night and had a beautiful room with kitchenette. The staff was very friendly and our stay at Calistoga was great! I will definately go again and recommend it to my friends and family. And for all the treatments we had plus an over night stay,it was reasonably priced. If you are looking for a peaceful getaway you can't go wrong with pampering yourself at Golden Haven Hot Springs!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a Spa or Resort!”
Reviews.Author: savysuz
Reviews.Content: I went there with my husand, sister & brother in law, who had flown in from Chicago. We were staying in San Francisco and going for several hours of pampering. First impression driving in: This CAN'T be it! It's a motel and looks like something you would find in the middle of nowwhere on a road trip. We were led into a dressing room of sorts and told to disrobe, put our personal belongs into a mesh hanging bag and put on a robe. The robes were a joke and did not appear to have been washed. We then had to drag our stuff in the hanging bag into the mud room. While the mud bath felt good, it was hard not to think about how many others I was bathing with if you know what I mean. We were then ushered into another room with our hanging bag for a blanket wrap where an old wool type blanket was thrown over us. When that was over, rather than just keeping us in the same where we've been relaxing, we are then led to another room, still dragging our stuff around, into the massage room. Apparently 2 out of 2 us got good massages while the other two recieved the worst massage we've ever had. Both of us were asked what our trouble spots were by the masseuse, who then completely disregarded what we said. I told my masseuse to feel free to "dig in" and I was told that was not the kind of massage she was giving me, that what I was getting is for people who are paralyzed, stroke victims, etc. What???!! The place was dark & dingy, appeared unclean and the $388 per couple + tips could have been better spent at a real spa and resort. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaniac0
Reviews.Content: We booked our room here well in advance due to some good reviews and the AAA California guide book. Once we arrived at this facility the sign at the entrance stated that this was a Motel and that's what it was. Your typical Motel with drive up parking. The only added feature was the Spa. The Rooms are very tired and really need an update. The water preasure in the shower was terrible. Be aware as it's nowhere listed that this is a Motel. If you're looking for a Motel to stay in Callistoge this is probably the place to go but by all means do not expect a resort as it's states because it is not. By the way, the pictures on their website look nothing like the real thing!!! The Mud bath expirience was very good however the massage afterwards was terrible and way over priced. We ended up leaving a day early due to the conditions of the place and stayed at a great Sheraton on the way back to San Francisco. Not a great start to a holiday but we made it work. Staff is generally friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Steal!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: theft_victim
Reviews.Content: The staff here stole my brand new digital camera. Management would not take accountability and would not take interest in the matter. In fact, they seemed not to care at all. I would never go here again and would not recommend anyone else go, unless you want your personal belongings stolen!

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Nice, Spa Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MissKey
Reviews.Content: We booked the couples mud bath online, and received an upgraded room. The room was very nice and clean, it looked like it had been recently remodeled. The pool was also nice. I wasn't crazy about the mud bath. I just didn't like how hot it was--I felt like I was suffocating. But aside from my personal feelings on the bath, it didn't really feel like the luxurious experience I was expecting for $75 each. The room was not at all relaxing--I felt like I was in someone's garage or basement. The person who helped us was wearing jeans and tennis shoes--not really professional. They gave us robes, but no thongs, and the floor didn't look clean enough to be comfortable walking on it barefoot.

Reviews.Title: “Unique mud bath experience”
Reviews.Author: kateben05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not stay at the motel; we only received the couples mud bath treatment there. After reading about the volcanic ash mud, I figured we had to try it. It was a once in a lifetime experience that I will probably not repeat, although it was kind of neat to try once. We arrived about 1/2 hr early for our appointment and they took us right away, even giving us $5 off more per person b/c we were in the "early bird" timeframe. I think partially b/c we were the first clients of the day, the mud was really HOT. We never really did get ourselves completely submerged which makes it kind of akward when the attendant comes in to check on you. After the mud bath, the shower was kind of warm also and then into the mineral bath hot tub, which was also very warm. After the hot mud, my husband and I couldn't stand the hot water. We got out early and hung out until our attendant came back. Then onto the blanket wrap (which was probably the nicest part for us), although I never really did feel relaxed at all. It was all too weird for us. Can now say that we did it though. We paid slightly less than $50 a person, so not any more overpriced that any other thing we did while vacationing in California. Wouldn't do it again, but interesting to have done it once.

Reviews.Title: “Achieving "Nirvana" at the Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa”
Reviews.Author: AlliCheat
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe how amazing my first time "spa" experience was at the Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa. Never before have I looked at mud with the new found admiration that I now have for it and the amazing effects it has had on my skin. The very first impression you get when pulling into the driveway of Golden Haven is defined in a word "Quaint". Little did I know the amazing experience I would endure that next morning as I embarked on my first spa appointment. Our guide "Jimmy" was so nice and was very good at making sure that we understood the mud bath and how to approach the tub. Next was the soak in the mineral pool and then the body wrap for a much needed cool down and "cat nap". Then it was on to the body massage and facial portion of my experience, and oh my goodness what a massage! Lila's hands were meant to heal and the natural masks used in my facial were not only theraputic but the entire sensation, as a whole, was incredible. I was there on a "Girl's Getaway" and as we left the spa we were void of all stress and impurities!! That night we were amazed at our skin and how great we all looked and felt. It was a weekend that I will never forget, the town of Calistoga is so fun and the shopping and restaurant's are the best I have ever experienced. I am two weeks now from having had the amazing treatments at Golden Haven and I can honestly say that my skin still feels wonderful and my heart yearns to visit that wonderful place again really soon! They meant it when they put the word "Haven" in Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa, for that is exactly what it is, a place with arms wide open to take in those restless and weary muscles that are so often rejected because of the human misconception that treating oneself is not a priority!! Make it a prority at this amazing spa and I guarantee that you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: crucible1
