Reviews.Content: positive: clean rooms; negative: smelly hot shower water (couldn't wash our hair in it); rude management staff; our massage appts. were running behind and had to be cancelled; we were rushed thru the mudd baths and had lack of privacey and were embarrassed due to having 2 young male attendants who kept popping in to check us 4 girls; it was no upscale spa, we were told we could walk into town from the spa, but found that the walk was rather a long one and there were some street areas that could have been a danger waiting to happen because of poor or no lighting. will not return to this place. there were others in the surrounding area that were more appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, skilled Team! Beautiful accommodations! Quaint town!”
Reviews.Author: RELAXEDSonoma_CA
Reviews.Content: We LOVE coming to Calistoga Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa & Resort (GHS)! This is our Annual get-away spot, and we will keep coming back! For a birthday GIFT 4+ years ago, my wonderful girlfriend surprised me with a GHS getaway. We had THE best experience. It is now a tradition. (In fact, I am writing this review from our beautiful room at GHS, because the owners provide free 'WIFI' for the entire resort!) My girlfriend booked our reservations via GHS's ‘user friendly’ website; she chose the 'Couples Ultimate Getaway Spa Pkg'. One of our favorite aspects of GHS is they’ve set up their facility to allow a couple to be pampered together, in the same room. From start to finish, we experience their personal pampering together. Even our 1 hour massages! So, when we have completed every extraordinarily peaceful phase; mud bath, jacuzzi, blanket wrap, and then our massage, we drag our noodle-like bodies to our resort room. The rooms are spacious, clean, neat, and well maintained by the excellent staff of GHS. If you haven't been to GHS in a while, you are going to be surprised by all the changes, inside and out. GHS is remodeling, upgrading and beautifying itself. And if you have YET to obtain professional, friendly, peaceful, and professional spa treatment, WE personally recommend a visit to Calistoga Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa & Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Pamperrrred”
Reviews.Author: free2california
Reviews.Content: I experienced the girl friend's special spa treatment and it was wonderful. We for the first time at age 52 both went all out and had the full treatment. Mud bath, mineral bath, mineral wrap, deep massage and facial not to mention the lovely hot tub and walks through the quaint town of Calistoga. We enjoyed lunch, dinner and breakfast in this peaceful atmosphere and were completed void of Stress! Wow, what a feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: mlgotschall
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday this year I wanted to do something special. We booked 1 night at Golden Haven with the mud bath/1 hr. massage special. This along with some wine tasting and a nice dinner in down town Calistoga proved to be one of my wife's favorite birthdays. The mud bath was memorable and the massages were perfect. A lmust do for any time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaWeekend
Reviews.Content: This is a retro, quiet escape. The room was simple and exceptionally clean. All staff were friendly. The hot water in the room came directly from the mineral hot spring. The mud bath, massage, and facial were a unique experience. There was also a 2 page handout in the room with info on local wineries that was extremely helpful. The discount coupon to a wonderful local downtown restaurant was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Get Away”
Reviews.Author: jfritzbiking
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have a fun and exciting 13th Wedding Anniversary. The Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa was the perfect get away. The couples spa was so refreshing,relaxing and romantic. My wife said that, "it was better than our honeymoon". The friendly staff treated us like family. We look forward to our next visit. Thank you, Jason Fritz

Reviews.Title: “Mud Bath better than expected; massage great!”
Reviews.Author: CassidyCarmichael
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went for a couples spa package last weekend for my 40th bday last weekend. What fun! My husband was really worried about the mud bath (he's a clean freak), but even he found it relaxing, comfortable, and fun. I would do the mud bath again - I think he is fine having done it ONCE in his life. I wasn't sure what to expect, having heard tales from others of attendants shoveling hot mud over you while you lay in the mud, and then being sprayed w/power hoses to get the mud off. Nothing could be further from the truth! The attendant tells you what to do, and then leaves you to get in/out of the mud while she's out of the room. She puts cool towels on your forehead, applies a soothing face mask, and explains what the mud is all about and answers questions. After around 15 min in the mud, she returns to tell you to get out, rinse off (there's a curtained-off area, with 2 showers - one for each of you, with a stone bench to sit on if you like) and then you hop in to the jacuzzi, where you relax while drinking cool lemon water. From there, go to the cool-down room, where you're swaddled like a baby in a room with candles, a gurgling water feature, and new age music (which I would normally hate, but didn't mind becuase I was so relaxed). We had 30 minute massages, which were fabulous! I recommend Marcia - who massaged my husband. I think he got a better treatment than I did... though I was happy w/my masseuse (forgot name). We were given a mesh bag to keep our clothes/shoes clean/dry, and flip-flops to walk around in. This seems contrary to what a previous poster mentioned. Golden Haven isn't the top of the line place, but for $108 each (check out online coupons), the 90 minute experience was a great value and a completely fun, relaxing experience. I want to return w/a friend or two. NOTE - don't go winetasting first - we were so glad we hadn't done so! All the heat of the mud and jacuzzi is dehydrating and would be uncomfortable if you had been drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Reddy2goCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Golden Haven was a Christmas present from me to my wife of 56 years, but I must admit I enjoyed the experience more myself than I ever expected to. I had never before even considered a mud bath, but feeling the soft penetrating heat of the mud enveloping my body was a sublime experience. The hour-long massage afterward was "the frosting on the cake" on an adventure I'll never forget. The spa's employees were extremely helpful in seeing that everything was just right. I am eagerly looking forward to returning in the very near future, and certainly recommend Golden Haven as the perfect place for an utterly relaxing and enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at the mud bath!”
Reviews.Author: miscalane
Reviews.Content: This place really exceeded our expectations for the price. We found an internet special for a cottage room (very clean, roomy and nice) and couples mud bath. Based on the low price and the area, we were prepared for a budget experience. Our room was top notch and the couples mud bath was nothing but fun. We knew we hadn't booked a treatment at the Biltmore, and we aren't very hoity-toity people, so for us, it was the perfect treat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: couldbemeg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the spa by telephone after viewing the information on line. it was one of the worse spa experiences that we ever had. The place was dinghy. There were no lockers for our clothes. We had to carry our clothes into all of the wet treatment areas. There were no slippers for out feet on a very rough floor. The massages were disgusting. The lights were on high overhead. The masseuse was without experience. My neck hurt worse after the massage because he did'nt use a neck extender when I was face down. Three hundred dollars to feel like sheep being herded into a stall.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SweetCoraline
Reviews.Content: My spa weekend at Golden Haven Hot Springs was definitely a great experience. Staff was friendly, accommodations were excellent, and most importantly, the spa package was most delicious. I very much appreciated the fact that Golden Haven offers solo packages, for those of us who prefer (or need??) to be alone to recharge our batteries. I will definitely go back to Golden Haven, same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: no_time_4_vacation
Reviews.Content: Back in December I booked our stay at Golden Haven Inn for my now fiancé and I. We were celebrating our 8yr. dating anniversary. Although my fiancé was not too keen on the idea of the mud bath I convinced him that it would be relaxing and romantic. Not only was the drive to Golden Haven a beautiful one but it was also very easy to get to. We passed several wineries and quaint little shops along the way. When we arrived we were greeted with kind faces and a laid back relaxing atmosphere. When it came time for our mud bath my fiancé became nervous. Our attendant was perfect; he was very respectful and helped put us at ease being that it was our first time in a mud bath. Once the mud bath was over we showered and soaked in a Jacuzzi all in the same fully tiled room. After the mud bath, shower and Jacuzzi soaking we were able to rest in a quaint candle lit room to rest and cool off. We were then greeted by our Massage Therapists. Our Therapists truly made the evening relaxing and wonderful. As a massage therapist myself I greatly appreciated not only the atmosphere but the professionalism of both therapists and the connection they made with both my fiance and myself. Did I mention that my fiancé proposed to me before our treatments? Well maybe it WAS my fiancé that really made the experience what it was for me but Golden Haven Inn and its staff also had a big part in making our weekend a truly memorable one. We will definitely be returning to Golden Haven in the future and I recommend to everyone that you consider the mud bath, it was truly divine. We would like to Thank Golden Haven Inn and its staff once again for a memorable and romantic experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGrizz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at this wonderful place. This was our first time to a spa of this type and I did a lot of research on what to expect. Some of the negative comments I read on this site were way off base. Yes it is set up in a motel atmosphere, but so are many of the others around this quaint little town. We stayed in a jacuzzi room which was clean and large. The bed was excellent and the room was quiet. We signed up for a mud bath treatment (our fist ever) and it was fabulous. The staff was very considerate of our requests, even though they were vary busy dealing with others. We did notice they were renovating some of the rooms so this might be something to request in the future. If you want a relaxing night we would recommend coming here. If your looking for a place to spoon feed you, your looking in the wrong place. For the price this place goes above and beyond. As for the own of Calistoga we ate at the Hydro Bar and Grill, the Pacifico Mexican and the Cafe Sarafornia had excellant service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Happily rested and rejuvenated”
Reviews.Author: MtnFolk
Reviews.Content: This was our second time together at Golden Haven. Small business owners, we like to take the long drive (5+ hours from home) down to recuperate after the Holi-daze and inventory are over. We like Golden Haven for a number of reasons. First of all, they are one of, if not the only, place in Calistoga that allow coed soaking and massages, so my husband and I can have our treatments together. They are far enough out of town that it is completely quiet. It is a nice walk to get to 'downtown' Calistoga, and we always just park at Golden Haven and walk everywhere (or bike, if we take our bikes). The pool is covered so it is good in any weather (and it is big enough for decent laps) and we tend to go in winter. We have had great mudbaths and excellent masseuses there, and they keep upgrading the place. Since last year they put in another hot tub (not as hot as the other) and re-carpeted the rooms and new bathroom fixtures. Works for us. our 2 days is like a week's worth of relaxation and we are able to head home refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Create a New You at Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa”
Reviews.Author: colonel624
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel pampered and come away feeling rejuvenated like nothing else in this world, then my wife and I recommend GHHSS. The staff is courteous, warm, and goes out of their way to give you the ultimate relaxing body treatment, bar none. We go to Golden Haven to get renewed and relaxed as we are teachers in the Bay areas middle schools. This Spa facility with the mud treatment, mineral baths, and massage therapy. really takes away the stress from a non stop 10 week teacher calendar term. I wish we could go every weekend. The rooms are spacious and clean, with all the amenities. The showers even have mineral salts, so you still feel like you're in the saunas, very invigorating.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: foxxcarz
Reviews.Content: My mother and I drove to Golden Haven from San Mateo, from the begin of the trip to the end of the trip we felt peaceful, welcome, and rested. Golden Haven had nice, clean, spacious, rooms, with a homey comfortable feeling to them. Our spa treatments were delightful, rejuvenating, comfortable, fun and restful. We were also pleasantly surprised at how wonderful the mud bath was. It was sanitary and very therapetic for the body and mind. We highly recommend all of the amenities offered by the spa and will be happy and grateful to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer Park Would be a Step Up !!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosCafe
Reviews.Content: I went there with my two girlfriends for the girlfriends spa package. It was a beautful ride until we were within a couple of blocks from the "resort". (BIG LAUGH) We knew that we were in big trouble. The area drastically changed. At this point my girlfriend and I looked at each other in total disbelief. From the web site it said it was a resort, but it was a MOTEL !!. We tried to give it the benefit of the doubt so we proceeded into the parking lot. We could not believe our eyes, the buildings were extremely old, there was rust on the walls, the enclosed pool area was behind bars and the window were covered with molded plastic. The premise looked nothing like it is protrayed on its web site. The room for the mud bath was disgusting. There was poor lighting and their was an awful smell that did not come from the mineral water. It also had yellow liquid dripping down the walls. The other side of the room appeared to be used as a storage area. The room used for massages was not clean either. The tables were lined with TRASH BAGS sealed with duck tape. It was apparent that the pillows and blankets was not freshly laundered. The rooms were not any better. When you first walk in to them you were greeted by the mold smell. The so-called sauna room was actually a sauna closet. It trully was the worst experience we have ever had. after a long discussion with the manager we were issued a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Left soon after arrival”
Reviews.Author: wherethehellami
Reviews.Content: Arrived with modest expectations and was very disappointed. This is a dated motel with some "quaint" accents disguising considerable wear. We tried to make it work -- looked at three rooms, but all had something bad: The first had stains all over the spread, and into the sheets; the second smelled like stale cigarettes (it was a non-smoking room); the third combined the first two rooms' flaws and added mold in the bath. I talked to the odd-ball manager, explained that I wouldn't accept the accommodations he was offering. He made no attempt to make the situation good. He appeared to be angry with me. But I am glad I was freed from my reservation, because this trailer-park of a place is comparitively overpriced and, yes, -- like the reviewer before me mentioned -- it is Big Gulp and a pitbull shy of white trash heaven. I ended up at Dr. Wilkinson's around the corner, and what a great stay that ended up to be!!! Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprize”
Reviews.Author: Engllishrose
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Golden Haven filled with trepidation, having read unfair reports in the trip advisor. I fell off my bicycle and broke my hip and was craving healing waters and mineral mud,so we decided to take a jacuzzi room and enjoy the waters come what may. We were delighted to find a pleasant room, spotlessly clean and equipped with small fridge, bottled water, tea, coffee and candy and plentiful fluffy towels and wash cloths. The room was remarkably quiet, tucked away from the main drag, with leafy trees. The staff were very pleasant and the spa facilities excellent. Yes, it's a motel, but you're not paying "Four seasons" prices. Especially in the off season, I think we had excellent value for money and the person who mentioned the smell must be unaccustomed to natural sulphur smells from all mineral springs. In fact, I was hardly aware of it, maybe because we took a perfumed candle. So, if you want a reasonably priced, clean, quiet spa experience and you're not a snob, go for Golden Haven. J.C.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: renotahoeboarder
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little place. Clean rooms, friendly staff. I stayed here for 2 nights with my friend for a wine tasting girls trip. We were totally pleased with the place. I read a few snobbish reviews complaing about the "trailer park" look of it and I have to disagree. While I'll admit that it wasn't luxury accomodations by any means, it was nice. What do you expect with the inexpensive room rates? You get what you pay for. If you're looking for luxury accomodations then you have to pay a lot for it especially in Napa. Those compaining must not have researched what a room/b&b goes for in Napa. Lots of money! For the price, this place is great. For those that are trying to be frugal but want to have a nice place to sleep this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven isn't the typical "spa experience."”
Reviews.Author: Mgh1209
Reviews.Content: A friend and I vacationed in Napa. I read Calistoga is known for mud baths and hot springs. So we deceided why not. I liked the mud bath. You float in the mud which is very hot at first but you get use to it. Next you shower to rinse off all the mud. By this time I was so hot. It would of been nice if we were able to cool down before the hotsprings bath. Finally you are taken to another room for a wrap where you cool down and are suppose to relax. The room was dim and would of been relaxing except you can hear everyone talking outside. We opted for an hour massage. I've had plenty of massages and this was nice because extra attention was given to hands,arms & feet. The atmosphere was average.There was a lot of foot traffic since the place was busy. This was surprising since it was 7pm but there's really no nightlife in Wine country so I guess this is what a lot of people do at night. The private treatment rooms were dark and not fancy. Our attendant was very nice and explained everything in detail. Drink lots of water! You'll need it! Overall, I would probably get another mudbath. If you are use to upscale spas this is probably not the palce for you. But if you're interested in trying something different, I would recommend Golden Haven.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway - great town!”
Reviews.Author: happy2explore
Reviews.Content: I came with a girlfriend for a brief getaway from SF and got the girlfriends spa package. The service is really good -- very friendly front desk staff with good recommendations for restaurants in town (very close by). The spa services were good -- the ambiance wasn't very fancy (staff dressed in Golden Haven t-shirts), but the staff members were very nice. You kind-of have to imagine you get what you pay for. This is a really great deal for the area and for the amount of services you get -- room, massage, facial, and mud bath. The spa experience was pretty relaxing. The rooms were fine -- we had a 2-bedroom suite, and the A/C didn't quite reach the 2nd room (but it cooled down at night). The bathroom fixtures were kind-of old (but patched up). It served its purpose though, so no big complaints there. The exposed wood ceiling was quite nice actually, and we appreciated all the trees on the property -- shady and pretty. Overall, a nice, relaxing, low-key getaway. Not fancy by any means, so it's just a matter of knowing not to expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvination at the Spa!”
Reviews.Author: feelingsublime
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I work in the spa industry and we desperatly needed to get away and have some rejuvination of our own. We give and give to all of our clients, but we seldom take time to see to our own needs. So we started looking around on the internet and we saw Golden Haven's web page. We were so impressed with all of their internet specials and incredibly affordable rates! So we though we'd give it a try. From the minute we walked in the front door we were treated with the upmost respect and personalized care. Although the spa was very busy with many customers our Spa Attendant made us feel like we were the only one's there. It was exactly what we needed. Our package included an overnight stay, the room was very spacious and comfortable. We were amazed that we still felt the wonderful effects of the treatments the next day when we got up. Needless to say we have told countless people about how wonderful we felt and how helpful the staff was. I strongly recommend that if you want a get-away with just the girls or your spouse, a visit to Golden Haven will be your ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at a White Trash Spa resort, how about no!”
Reviews.Author: jenwri
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise honeymoon for my brand spanking new husband and myself at a "spa resort" in beautiful calistoga. You can imagine my shock when we arrived to find what looked like a trailer park get-up. We drove by and decided to look around town before actually approaching the guest relations office. After finding a cute little inn in town that luckily had room, we returned to the golden haven and canceled our reservations. I did ask to see the room before we canceled, to be fair. The room looked more like something you'd rent by the hour or month and the smell was unbearable. The staff was kind enough to cancel our reservations without hassel. While I think the internet is a valuable source for finding hotels and travel information, I do feel that their website is deceiving and there are no real pictures of the hotel. I advise you think more than twice before booking here, considering it isn't priced very affordably!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On July 8th and 9th, my sister in law and a girlfriend walked the Avon Walk for Breast Cancer, a 2 day, 39 mile walk. On top of this great expierence we had just journeyed, our husbands joined us for a day of wine tasting and a nite at Golden Haven Spa. This was our first time here and also my first time at a spa, so I really didn't know what to expect. My husband bought me a message and a mud bath. I had a message done first. Paul was the lucky man to give me my first massage. I informed him of my Breast Cancer surgery and was very concerned and gentle in the area. It was very appreciated. Paul even thru in some deep tissue message to help out the muscles after a 30+ mile walk. I was very impressed and felt great. Then I met Sergio. He made us 3 girls feel so at ease while having fun at the same time. Sergio sat on the edge of these mud tubs and explained how to jump in. Left the room, we got in...whoooo..HOT! Sergio was right, don't let your feet get close to the bottom! After a few minutes, knock on the door, Sergio steps in, adjusts your back, places a facial and a cold towel on the head. Wonderful! The after wrap was just heaven, very very relaxing. After our spa treatments, we checked into our rooms. We had the $99.00 a nite, Kingsize bedroom. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean and the shower...well thats something I think everyone has to get used to. The landscaping was beautiful, the pool area very relaxing. We will most definetly be back. Thanks for a great weekend. Teresa SF BayArea

Reviews.Title: “This is a Motel! A Motel I tell you!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I looked at the website and it looked like an affordable spa getaway in the Napa valley for my wife and I. Circumstances prevented us from getting there the night before as we had planned and that is just onemore way that I know that God is real and that he loves me. When we did arrive. The sign said Golden Haven Spa AND MOTEL. There was no mention of a MOTEL on the website and for good reason. Had I known that I was going to a motel with soothing vats of molten mud, I might not have gone. The mud is super heated and I will always be able to tell my wife that I endured boiling mud for her. I fail to see how this can be a pleasurable experience. After you get over the shock of being at a motel its really not that bad. They do hose you down after the mud bath and hey, that's special. I would truly have been angry had I arrived in time to stay for the night expecting more spa and less motel. The staff was friendly but I do believe they shade the truth in their self description.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Trailer Park”
Reviews.Author: trigirl81
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I decided to do the girls weekend at Golden Haven after reading all the positive reviews on this site. I was shocked when I pulled up to this little motel outside of town that looked like a trailerpark. My friend and I looked at each other with that "oh what have we gotten ourselves into" look. I have to admit that the room wasn't bad for the four of us and the staff was pleasant - they gave us late checkout so we could shower after our spa treatments the next morning. The sulfur smell in the water was disgusting but I expected that. That evening we visited the pool and spa, which turned out to be full of locals (I don't know how they got in there since there is a gate code). It seemed like bad hotel management. The next morning we got up and did our package at the spa. First of all they give you the most hideous robes - thin, plaid or paisley - like something a guy would wear. The mud bath was "interesting" and something I don't think I need to repeat. The blanket wrap afterwards was a huge disappointment. The massage and facial were okay, but subpar to everything I've had in the past. We could hear everyone talking outside and the doors were extremely loud. If you're used to staying in nice places, don't go here. If you're used to spa treatments where you get nice fluffy robes and leave pampered and relaxed, don't go here. Overall, definitely not worth the price per person.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT COUPLES GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight stay and spa treatments for my husband's birthday. We had a superior room, which was everything we needed, the bed was comfortable and they gave us two pillows each. There was an in room coffee maker and small refrigerator. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They have a heated pool and spa with mineral spring water. We played in the pool and spa and had a wonderful time. The following day we had couples mud baths and then one hour massages. I just can't say enough about the friendly service they provided, our privacy was very much respected and the treatments were heavenly. We want to especially thank Sarah for her service, she was absolutely wonderful, and she made us feel comfortable and explained the whole process. My husband and I made a promise to each other that we would come back at least once a year to the Golden Haven for a private get away. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Golden Haven Spa in Calistoga, CA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Golden Haven Spa in Calistoga, CA in May of 2006 for a 10 year anniversary celebration. I was debating between going to Dr. Wilkinson's spa which was recommended in The Unofficial Guide to San Francisco; however when looking on the internet I came upon Golden Haven Spa in which the pictures were more enticing than the other spa. We did the ultimate getaway package which included a night's stay, a mud bath, a jaccuzi soak, a blanket wrap and a massage. It was a unique and wonderful experience. The room was really cute resembling a cottage loft with a window near the ceiling that you could view the tall trees while lying in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven spa evaluatio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The spa is very good to excellent, but we stopped going there as the person in charge was extremelly unfriendly. He was displeased with something and literary tore a towel from my wife's hands. It was close to personal assault, but we let it go.

Reviews.Title: “Splendidly spoiled in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa was a delightful getaway from the rat race. We had a romantic evening in our room which had a huge jacuzzi tub filled with mineral water and fragrant bath salts. We enjoyed breakfast and shopping in the quaint town of Calistoga the next day and then were treated to a fabulously relaxing massage and facial. The staff was wonderful and attentive and I ended the weekend with a totally rejuvenated body and renewed spirit and soul. It is a lovely way to get away from it all...there is an outdoor pool and spa, sunbathing, areas for quiet picnics or group gatherings. I highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a person who worries over bugs in the room, the ones the maid misses, but I have to say the room was spotless, everything was clean, very clean. The rooms were spacious and the parking in front of the room was nice so we could keep an eye on our rental car. The only thing I didn't like was the spring water in the tub, it had a sulfer smell and we never did get used to it even after three days. However, in the area, most of the water smelled the same way, so if you are going to stay in this region, you'll have to deal with it at every hotel. Also the rooms were very affordable for the area and the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, Release, and Let Go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven is the spa of choice! I've been going there since the early eighties. I've taken my mother for special occasions, I've gone with a few lady friends for weekend get-a-ways, with my husband, or just by myself. They've ugraded the facilities a great deal from the earlier times I went and now, it is definitely the ambience to take in. I shared Golden Haven with my brother-in-law last year when we spent the weekend and when he was planning his vacation this year, who did he call to get the spa's information? That's right, he called me because, as he puts it, "I have never experienced anything like that and we just had to come back again." When friends come to town, I always suggest if they want a experience of a life time, go to Golden Haven. I introduced "The Works" to my husband and you can't get him to try anything else. I thoroughly enjoy going to Golden Haven and will continue until I can no longer make it on my own. The setting of the facility is tranquil off the busy street of Lincoln. What else can I say. If you're looking for something different - Take a chance and book a treat at Golden Haven. Ms V

Reviews.Title: “A great place to get away with friends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend Shanna and I got away for a couple of days without the kids and husbands. We checked into the Goldenhaven Inn then drove to the many Wineries that were nearby. We found a great restaurant in Calistoga where we had a delicious dinner then called it a night early. She had a queen bed and I had the king bed. Just having huge beds to ourselves was a treat! The room was very large and had everything we needed. The next day we started with a mud bath, it was a unique experience. We both enjoyed it. We soaked in the mineral water jaccuzzi then were taken to the blanket wrap room. You do get very hot during all of this. There was always a pitcher of refreshing ice water with lemon within reach.We finished with an hour massage. It felt great to be totally pampered. I would say this is a great place to go because you get so much for your money. The staff was very friendly and helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “It was a motel not a spa.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is as cheap of a spa experience as you can get.....employees were nice and massage was ok once you forget that you are in a motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a spa”
Reviews.Author: sbeia
Reviews.Content: If you've ever been to a real spa, don't go here! Large masses are hearded to their appointments, some of which take place in motel rooms, only after they've walked you through the parking lot in what looks like great uncle frank's plaid robe! Men and women are grouped together, there is no separate waiting area. Everything was clean and reasonably priced but not really worthy of the label of SPA....more like an EXPERIENCE. Needless to say my 3 girlfriends and myself laughed ALOT!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visit”
Reviews.Author: cc1158
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our day at the spa, did the ultimate getaway treatment. Had a superior room, King bed with 2 person tub. 4 jets. would have liked to have more power on the jets but had trouble turning it up. But as I have the same problem on my whirlpool tub at home, I couldn't really hold that against them too badly. We barely noticed the mineral water smell at all. As you fill the tub before you get in you don't have any odor except when you're in the tub and then not much. You can also adjust the temp to your liking. Everything was clean and the sheets were soo soft. Nice but not luxury. The spa treatment was great we talked to another couple that were somewhat local and were back for the 4th or fifth time. Staff were friendly and very helpful. I've been getting massages regularly for years and this one was very goood!!

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel”
Reviews.Author: e_gorey
Reviews.Content: This was basically a clean motel with a spa. It is centrally located, but nothing to write home about. The glaring lights and noise outside made it difficult to sleep, and spa services were average at best. If you're planning a weekend spa getaway to Napa, you may as well spend a bit more money to get the royal treatment at a resort or good full-service day spa. I'm skeptical about the string of 5-star reviews below because they sound remarkably similar in that they contain the same sentence structure, describe the "special package," and several use key words in ALL CAPS. Perhaps they were written by management and designed to counteract the negative reviews before them. This hotel doesn't deserve 5 stars even for the price; there are plenty of better and cheaper places to stay if all you need is a bed. 3 stars is generous - I would say more like 2.5.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ultimate Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the "Ultimate Getaway" package and it was wonderful!! We were pampered with a mud bath, jacuzzi time, blanket wrap and an hour massage. Each experience was enjoyed as a couple. No awkward feelings like you can have if you had to do the treatments alone with complete strangers. Our room was great with a nice comfy king size bed!! It was very clean and well maintained. Thank you Alma, Liza and Bahgu. You all made our experience a memorable one! We will DEFINATLEY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Calistoga: Golden Haven Spa Date: April 7, 2006 Reviewer: Douglas Powers My wife and I had probably the most relaxing and wonderful weekend of our married life(22yrs)! Thank you so much for your courteous and efficient staff that helped make our stay one to long remember. We have every intention of returning, and hopefully convince family and friends to also make reservations for a weekend of sheer enjoyment and relaxation. We were thinking, your name should be; Golden Heaven instead! Sincerely Doug and Carol Powers

Reviews.Title: “Our Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Golden Haven for the second time. We indulged in the "Ultimate Getaway". The rooms are very clean. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. The spa package is great. You will love it! It is an obligatory visit when we have the opportunity to visit the Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “Most accomodating Spa ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I recently stayed at the Golden Haven Spa to celebrate a 50th birthday celebration. We had the "Girlfriends Special" package which included a spacious and beautifully decorated suite (actually very similar to a cottage but attached to other units!) and an assortment of absolutely wonderful spa services. None of us were accustomed to such decadence nor such special treatment, but even more important to mention, two of my sisters are visually impaired (one is totally blind). Both were initially quite apprehensive and worried as to what these experiences might be like for someone without sight...Well, the entire staff was extremely accomodating and each one did a marvelous job of describing every step of the treatments and the layout of the rooms as they were proceeding along! Needlesstosay, both of my sisters had an absolutely wonderful experience as did my other sister and I! I highly recommend this very special haven for all!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found Golden Haven on the Internet and didn't know anyone who had been to this spa so we had our fingers crossed that our 10th anniversary trip to the Napa Valley would pair well with our stay at Golden Haven. It's a little off the main street and we thought we'd taken wrong turn at first, but from the moment of check-in until we left, it was a completely relaxing, self-indulgent experience that we hope to repeat this summer. We stayed in the jacuzzi room and it was wonderful to soak right before going to bed and first thing in the morning. We had signed up for the couples mud bath and giggled like kids when we were left alone to wriggle down into the mud. It was heaven! We both dozed off (easy after a day of visiting wineries) but the hot spring fed mud bath was extremely relaxing and hot enough for my "make me sweat" husband who figured out how to move around to increase the temperature around him. I like a little cooler than he does so I simply didn't move and found the temperature of the mud to be perfect. We washed off, soaked in the jacuzzi and headed for our heated blanked wrap (nap time again) and then an hour long-massage. We had plans of going out for dinner afterwards, but felt so great that we went back to our room and stayed there for the rest of the night. The facilities were clean, the people were friendly and we saw several relaxed, happy people walking around the spa. We highly recommend Golden Haven for your next visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “We love Golden Haven Spa & Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have tried our best to visit Golden Haven at least twice a year to relax and rejuvenate. This last visit was as always wonderful and we came away again vowing to try and make it more then twice a year. What added to us wanting to return were the wonderful upgrades we saw not only in the room but on the grounds. From new furniture to new plants all the new additions were very pleasing. As always the staff is great to deal with and everyone we encountered were willing to help make our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “After 21 years, it keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started going to Golden Haven back in 1985. We always do the Mud Bath/Mineral Water Whirlpool/Body Wrap/Massage routine. You come out of there SO relaxed and ready to face the world! The masseuses are all very professional, the facilities are kept exceptionally clean (even the mud bath rooms!), and everyone is very friendly and helpful. I would give a special mention about my masseuse G, but then he would get so popular I would be able to get him! Needless to say, whenever we go back to Napa, we will always go to Golden Haven.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up for Golden Haven Spa”
Reviews.Author: Shoresfine
Reviews.Content: I have tried other spas in the Calistoga area, but was never truly satisfied until my sisters and I met at Golden Haven for our "Spa Day". From the moment we walked into the lobby, I knew we had made the right choice. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and our treatments were personalized and special. From the aromatherapy mineral bath to the lucious massages, we left Golden Haven feeling rejuvinated and refreshed. It one of the best spa experiences I have ever had. It was the personal care that was taken at this spa that will make me a repeat client! Nancy Mayo Branford, CT

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a two time client of Golden Haven Spas, I find that the service, products, and care to be quite exceptional. This past Christmas I brought my mother-in-law there for the first time. She had never been to a spa before and was very pleased with the service she got. We took picturs of her receiving a facial, and ending her massage. In 2004, during my first visit, I got a mud bath. I was so ecstatic about then that this past year, I got another one. I think I'm addicted. I will definately be back. This Spring, I am planning on bringing about 4-6 women with me for an afternoon at the spa outting. Golden Haven is a great place, and I highly recommend it to all. Thank you Golden Haven for making my experience so memorable. Peace and God Bless, Shereel Washington

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven Spa is a must Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: msc1969
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoy the Golden Haven Spa on an annual trip to Calistoga. We always have such a wonderful and relaxing experience and look forward to going back each year. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The spa is extremely clean and the service is outstanding!! I recommend this spa for all of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but careful...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my best friend for two nights. The staff were friendly up until we made the payments. Then they started hurrying. We got the spa treatment and same thing happened that morning. After we made the payment, they couldnt be bothered and rushed us through the whole experience. It was a really good experience but I would have liked a bit less rushed experience. We stayed in the room upstairs from the reception. The first night, we couldnt sleep well most of the night as the bright lights in the balcony were on all night. The light through the window (even with blinds on the window down) was really bright. So, when we asked them if it was possible to turn the lights off - they just shrugged and shook head without any concern as if it's our problem. The only time they seem to care was when we were making any payment otherwise they wouldnt even greet us with a smile. The rooms were good for value, they were clean, quiet, and functional. But the service is really bad. I would consider staying at a different place next time if I do decide to visit again. Definitely ask for a room where you dont have a light in front of your window.

Reviews.Title: “bum rap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Did not use spa facilities, but needed a simple room for an overnight. Using a coupon clipped from Spa's website, we had a very reasonable overnight stay in a simple but scrupulously clean motel-type room. We were warned that hot water would have sulfur smell (it is, after all, a hot springs destination!) so we were prepared. The staff treated us courteously. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The management is arrogant and incompetent - avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A complete waste of time and money - management was arrogant and incompetent. Avoid this place at all costs! We reserved a two room suite with kitchenette. When we arrived at the hotel our room had been given away to someone else. We were part of a wedding party and gift had already been left in the room for us the night before. Still the greedy hotel manager had the nerve to rent our room to someone else! We had to get dressed for the ceremony in a public restroom. Gross! After much debate the hotel manager offered us a smaller room that would not be ready until evening, meanwhile charging us for the suite. The management at this 'budget spa' did her best to try and ruin our experience in Napa. I will never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Golden Haven”
Reviews.Author: Cownie
Reviews.Content: We love visiting hot springs and spas and our overnite stay at Golden Haven was one of our favorites. The room was clean, spacious and cheerful. The housekeeping standards were first rate. We chose Golden Haven because we were able to take mudbaths together instead of in separate bath houses that were at the other spas in the area. Our attendant was wonderful. She was the fourth generation in her family to live in Calistoga. She was extremely attentive and caring and made our spa experience so very enjoyable and relaxing. We had mudbaths, showers, mineral spa and a great blanket wrap... all wonderful. We also enjoyed the indoor swimming pool and the mineral water jacuzzi. There was also mineral water available in our bathtub! Golden Haven is quiet and peaceful. It's just a few blocks from the downtown area. We are looking forward to our next visit and are recommending it highly to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Our Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and her friends have often stayed at the Golden Haven Spa. She raved about the accommodations, service, staff, and the cost value of this experience. I got an opportunity as a Christmas gift from my wife to stay and experience this outstanding spa. It took a little convincing to do the mud bath but I figured what the heck. In addition, I have never had a massage and I was a little bit leary. The staff was very attentive to our needs and walked us through the entire experience. I can only say we both came away feeling completely relaxed and satisfied. This was truely an amazing experience. Our room was exceptionally clean and well appointed. The high ceilings and sky light with the pounding rain made for a memorable evening. The spa is also centrally located close to town with phenominal restaurants and unique shops nearby. The online discounts offered made this an extremely good value. We have recommended this to all our friends and have, in fact, returned for another weekend getaway. We would challenge anyone to find a better value or experience in the Napa Valley. Don L. Mountain View, CA

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend this Place”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a spa weekend and I would not recommend this place. This is essentially a motel, loud heater, dirty drapes and carpet, shabby bathroom. What really bothered us was the smelly shower due to the sulfer water being pumped directly into the roomm. The spa is also like a factory. You get a cheap polyester robe to wear and a mesh bag to carry your things in as you get ushered from room to room. We could not wait till our mud bath treatment to be over and we checked out early the next morning. I would not retrn to this property for anything and am glad that we only booked the mud bath.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a TERRIBLE experience at this spa. Admittedly we were 10 minutes late for our appointment for a couples mud bath and massage, but we did not feel the treatment we received was called for. The reception staff were unfriendly and unprofessional. They acted as if they were exasperated and seem inconvenienced at having to wait on us. We felt exteremly unwelcome. We had signed up for an hour mud bath and an hour massage at a promotional rate. Because we were 10 minutes late, our massage time had to be cut in half. Thankfully, we were charged a pro-rated promotional rate. However, the relatively inexpensive price was no consolation for very poor service. In fact, after the entire experience we still felt as though we had been "ripped off." We did not know what to expect with the mud bath, as it was our first experience. This part of our spa treatment seemed very rushed. Our attendant seemed somewhat friendly, but seemed to push us through each of the stages of the mud bath, mineral soak and blanket wrap as though we were in a race. The actual soak time in the mud was about 10 minutes, which we heard, after some research, is probably the shortest soak time alloted amongst all the other spas in Calistoga. During the blanket wrap, we were supposed to retire or even nap in relaxing silence. And despite a sign posted right outside the room requesting quiet, we heard loud laughing and talking the whole time, which made it extremely difficult to fall asleep let alone relax. Our half hour massage was probably the best part of our experience, although that is not saying much. The massage therapists greeted us and bid us farewell very hastily. However, the massage was fairly good, but definitely not near the best we've had. (Perahps we are a bit biased in this opinion because we were already pretty upset by this point.) Overall, we had a very disappointing experience, especially since we had been looking forward to it for a while. We both felt a lot LESS relaxed coming out of the spa than we did going in! We kept joking that what we needed now was a massage since we felt a bit stressed! We would definitely not recommend this spa to anyone. It is much more worth your while to pay a little extra to get much better service. After our very disheartening experience, we went shopping around at several other spas in Calistoga. It seemed like common knowledge among the locals that Golden Haven has a reputation for providing rushed, unfriendly service and for "herding" their large numbers of customers through their spa experiences. In some cases, all we had to mention was that we had an extremely poor spa experience and people guessed exactly where we were talking about. That is pretty bad! If friendly, welcoming, accomodating service is essential to you to have a good experience, please do not waste your time here! In spite of the many positive reviews this spa has received, we definitely encourage you to shop around and get a feel for what the locals' opinions are. We think that you will find that every spa will recommend itself, but the good spas will also have some recommendations for other good spas in the area and will have a strong opinion as to where NOT to go, which will be.......take a guess!!! We hope you have a better experience than ours wherever you decide to go!

Reviews.Title: “Not as inexpensive as I hoped...”
Reviews.Author: AL-the-squid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Nov 2005. I was looking for an inexpensive place to stay so we could spend some money on wine. They were out of $99 rooms for the weekend, so we ended up with a $149 room with vaulted ceiling, king bed and kitchenette. The room was really nice. To stay there on a weekend you have to sign up for a spa treatment. We did the mud bath and half hour massage. I thought the mud bath was too hot and very gimmicky. The massage was good. I had a coupoon from their website, but they herded us through the front office so quickly I forgot to give it to them, and thye wouldn't take it later. So somehow my bill for 2 nights and 2 treatments ended up at $550. I didn't even get an itemized listing of costs. A bed and breakfast probably would have been a cheaper choice after all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Golden Haven Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: October 28, 2005 was our 10th Wedding Anniversary and my husband arranged for us to spend 2 nights at the Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa, in Calistoga, California. We purchased the couples Mud Bath, Mineral Springs Bath and Massage. This was our first experience with a Mud Bath and I was a little nervous; however, the Attendant assigned to us was truly wonderful. She answered all of our questions thoroughly and put my concerns to rest. The Mud Bath itself was rejuvenating. I have never felt my skin this soft. Our attendant anticipated all of our needs and she was very professional and courteous. The next experience 4 hours later was the couples massage. My Massage Therapist's name was Adam and he was awesome! I have had a massage before, but it didn't even come close to this experience. I have had 6 spinal fusions, cervical, thorasic and lumbar with plates and hardware, and my back is in constant pain. The technique Adam uses, allowed him to reach a DEEP tissue level massage that loosened up the muscles and left me totally relaxed. He was also very professional and attentive to my needs, understanding my back's condition. I must also comment on the Front Office staff, because their warm, courteous welcome started the weekend off smoothly. Ten years ago on this date I experience a one of a kind event with my wedding, and ten years later we experienced a one of kind spa treatment at Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa that I totally recommend to anyone looking for rejuvenation and relaxation. We are looking forward to our return trip. Thank you for the once in a life time, First experience encounter.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Haven exceeds expectations for a touristy (impersonal, mass produced services) area. Rooms are immaculate, comfortable, reasonably priced. The pool and jacuzzi (hot springs fed) are a joy; tons of towels supplied! Staff are unpretentious, friendly and helpful; spa services excellent and available into the night. Location is perfect, a five-minute (flat!) walk through lovely leafy neighborhood to main street for meals and shopping, one block to highway out to Silverado or hikes up Mt. St. Helena and the dramatic, lava palisades overlooking the valley. The Hummers and Escalades share the parking lot with the Volvos and VWs. Everybody, it seems, loves this place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Haven for two nights in mid-September. It was one of the most reasonably priced places we could find, and we really enjoyed it. Because we were on our honeymoon, we splurged and got the king bed with jacuzzi ($199/night). We really could have skipped that, and a queen bed is only $99/night. The smell of sulfur does permeate the place, especially when the jacuzzi is pumping. I don't mind the smell, so it didn't bother me at all. The place is clean and functional, but not luxurious by any means. They are very busy, and the staff are friendly but seem a little harried, as they manage both the hotel and the spa. We indulged in the couples mud bath, jacuzzi, and blanket wrap, and each had an hour-long massage. This was great, and very reasonably priced ($139 each for the entire package). The mud baths were an interesting experience (our first), but were very relaxing. The massages were great. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone seeking an inexpensive hotel and good, reasonably-priced spa treatments.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Gettaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the wine country. We originally had a reservation at a hotel in Napa. My husband was nautious from the smell of the sulfur. We checked out 15 min. after we had checked in. With a throbbing headache, checked into the 1st floor room at the Golden Haven Resort where we were welcomed by the front desk asking if we would like to schedule our spa treatments. It was a couples massage that got rid of our headaches. Great time in the mineral springs pool.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back SOON!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have been to many of the Spas in Calistoga, but last weekend I took my husband for the 1st time. We went to Golden Haven- I believe they're the ONLY co-ed spa there.My husband was nervous and doubtful of the experience, but he ALSO can't wait to go back!The people were friendly, Maria (who guided us thru) was wonderful ! The grounds are quite nice, and the mud (seems everyone has a different "type", was some of the best I've been in!) All the way home my hubby kept saying he couldn't believe how much he enjoyed it. I am and will continue to recommend Golden Haven to my friends and family !

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first experience with this hotel left me not wanting to ever return. I dreamed of a quiet relaxing atmosphere, but my room was right over the outdoor jacuzzi pump which loudly pumped from 8:00am through about midnight. This room should never had been rented to anyone. The noise prevented me from having the window open, and this was especially bad because the smell from the mineral water permeated the room--coming from the pool and jacuzzi area, as well as the bathroom in the room. The whole room smelled like a uncleaned bathroom. All the hot water in the rooms comes from the mineral water springs--so unless you love this smell on your hair and skin, you have to skip a warm shower and wait till you get to the next city's hotel room to freshen up. So much for quiet and relaxing. More like noisy and the antithesis of aromatherapy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I visited Golden Haven for a mother/daughter spa weekend and it was wonderful. The modest rooms were very clean and comfortable. Our room had an extra bedroom with a door which added privacy (very nice). As others have mentioned, the location is in a mostly residential neighborhood, but this didn't bother us at all. In fact, we enjoyed walking around the neighborhoods and taking the short (about 8 blocks) walk to the downtown area of Calistoga. The spa was fabulously relaxing. The spa staff was great (the front desk staff seemed slightly stressed). We really enjoyed the mud bath and we both had wonderful massage therapist. We’re already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this place!! I treated my daughter to a trip for her birthday. This was her first time to a spa. We were greeted warmly and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were comfortable and very quiet. That was a BIG plus. the grounds were kept up great. Very clean. THe pool was wonderful. Now the actual spa treatment was the best. The facility was very clean and we had a good time joking with the staff. We had a spa package for two and the mud bath/Jacuzzi room was very nice. The young man that attended to us was very nice and always respectful of us. The blanket room was great for a quick nap before our massage. The ladies that gave us our massages were wonderful. Very attentive and absolutely catered to our needs. It was all we could do to walk back to our rooms when it was over. When we wanted to go to town for something to eat they were more than helpful in pointing out some great places to eat. Which is all of Calistoga! I would highly recommend Golden Haven Hot Springs to anyone wanting a quiet, relaxing and pampering kind of vacation! I can't wait for my sisters to come visit so we can enjoy this spa together. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Great spa-reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: wmheike
Reviews.Content: A short 5 minute walk to the heart of Calistoga, this spa is off the traffic route that other spa facilities are on. The rooms are well appointed and quiet. There is a heated pool with mineral water. The mud bath treatment (a special price with the room) with the jacuzzi and herbal wrap are soothing and relaxing. The staff is well trained and helpful. Get a massage after the treatment for a perfect end to the day.

Reviews.Title: “A neat experience for couples in need of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: beckat916
Reviews.Content: I recently visited this resort during a surpise getaway gift from my girlfriend. We were a little worried about the quality upon arriving on the street where the resort was located. Once we drove onto the property we felt better about the location, and only the neighborhood looked "iffy". The rooms were nice and the Jacuzi in the room was HUGE!! The natually heated water from the hot springs in your shower, tub, and sink was a treat. We sat in our big jacuzi tub and watched TV for hours. We did the couples mud bath, spa, facial, blanket wrap, and massage. THis experience was heavenly and a much needed stress reliever. It was great that we could go through the whole experience together and not be apart for any of it. The room and property were not what you would call luxury or five star. I did enjoy the overall experience and rated it above average due to the wonderfull couples spa accomidations...Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Couples looking for a romantic mud bath - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MomOf4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from celebrating our anniversary. We were excited about experiencing a mud bath as a "COUPLE". I had seen there website and the pictures looked like it was a nice spa & resort offering a wonderful experience, but looks can be deceiving!! We booked our mud bath and upgraded our spa package to include a mini massage and facial (big mistake). At six o'clock we were greeted by our attendant. A nice girl but not very professional. Once in our robes, she escorted us into our mud bath room. It was awful!! It smelled VERY bad, the room was run down with old mats, old pipes and old everything else. We were told to hurry in to our mud baths so we can be in there longer. Our attendant kept coming in and out and telling us what our next step was. No privacy whatsoever. After our mud bath, she had us get into a shower which was surrounded by old hanging curtains. She came back in and started her clean up duty, as we showered. Then we were told to get into the mineral bath tub (old rusted jacuzzi) as she re-entered our room and proceeded to hose down the shower curtain. Not very romantic. My husband and I were so anxious to get this over with we did not even have a chance to enjoy each other. Once we were in our blanket room she turned off the light and closed the door so we can have some quiet time. But needless to say, right out side our room they have signs that says "Quiet Please" it was everything but that. Everyone in the hallway was laughing and talking so LOUD that we had trouble relaxing during this time. Finally we had 2 nice massage therapists take us upstairs to a room where we finally had a nice massage followed by a FACIAL. Beware: Do Not have a facial as you will leave with a BAD Sour Milk Smell on your face for hours. They used some kind of rose/whip cream treatment that left a horrible smell on my face. I could not wait to warn others NOT TO COME TO GOLDEN HAVEN SPA & RESORT for a "COUPLES MUD BATH OR ANYTHING ELSE!! You will be sorry!! I was hoping for a wonderful anniversary experience but this ended up being a cheap motel spa experience... Couples - Look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations - Lovely Spa & Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of relaxing and recovering from the stresses of urban living at the Golden Haven for several years. The rooms are comfortable, the indoor mineral pool is warm and inviting, the staff are helpful, and the spa services are excellent. It is a few blocks walk to the interesting shops and restaurants on the main street, yet is in the residential area of Calistoga. I highly recommend it to my friends for an overnight or two of leisure.

Reviews.Title: “The spa might be nice but the motel rooms are not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 15 for one night last week. The bed was seriously the MOST uncomfortable bed we have EVER slept in! Sorry to be so blunt! It was a Murphy bed with no boxspring. I am sorry, but they should definitely disclose that this is a murphy bed when we reserved the room. It was not worth $69 per night, which is what we paid. I even contemplated sleeping on the floor. One good thing is the grounds are nice. However, that is the only redeeming quality. We will NOT be back. Word to the wise: check out the River Terrace Inn in Napa. MUCH nicer for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Spa Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This year my 62 year old mother came to visit me from Galena, IL. I had not seen her in 7 years. Her past years had aged her much. With great pain and suffering. I could not think of a better gift than to give her the gift of the Calistoga Spa experience. I choose to come to Golden Haven so that I could experience this with her. THe facility looked the best I had ever seen it. All of the reinvations are great. This was an experience of a life time for someone from the Mid West. Thank You, Thank You, Thank You. You are doing the work of a higher power.

Reviews.Title: “What a Transformation!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One Saturday my sister and I decided to take a road trip and we ended up in Calistoga. Its a lovely spring day so why not treat ourselves! We went to 3 different spas with no luck. Our last stop was Golden Haven. Not only did they fit us in they had a room! What a room it was lovely! The french doors to the entry of our room was just the start! We had 2 double beds, high ceilings a complete kitchenette! Sky light that led to the bathroom. The room was gorgeous! That evening we went for our treatment for our mud bath and massage. Now I must tell that I have been a therapist for 20yrs. The gentle and loving way they catered to me was unbelievable! They where right on time. My mud bath was out of this world! All my tension just faded in the heat of the mud. Followed by a whirl pool soak. Then came the body wrap! Oh My God! I thought I was in Heaven! When Paul took me up for my massage I got on the table. Paul was terrific! Not only was he curtious with the draping it was one of the best massages I had recieved in a very long time! I believe Golden Haven has the best staff most nurturing people I have met in a long time! It is nice to know that there are people out there that still care for the humane race. Thank You Barry for taking the time to fit us in on one of your busiest days of the week. A time we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fellow Workaholics/Overachievers/Wary Mudbathers/Friends, Golden Haven Spa transformed three women into Goddesses. Well almost. March 27th, 2004, I took my 72 year old aunt, my sister and myself on a day trip. We found ourselves at the Golden Haven Reception Counter, we were "walk-in" customers but we were treated like royalty. Barry, not only found a suite for us, we received every service available at the times we wanted. This was absolutely amazing, as we had already stopped at three other spa resorts and could only receive one or none of the services we wanted. I have always been a skeptic as to mud bathing, however my assistant, Theresa, made the experience comforting and secure, to my surprise like floating on warm fluffy clouds. My aunt, Minda was a first timer as well and she was so pleased with the transforming therapies that she will return every year with her visits to California, her words,"I've found the fountain of youth, the best gift anyone could ever receive." The massage therapists, the staff were very courteous and caring, making sure to provide us with every comfort. Our facials, unbelievable, what a service, more like a circular body massage, so impressive. I am a WorldMark/Interval International/Trendwest Owner and I must say this has equalled if not surpassed the personal care and courtesy we received at Golden Haven Spa. I would like to thank, Barry, Theresa and the entire staff for making this one of our most memorable mini vacations. The painting in the lobby tells it all! Delighted to have entered the Pearly Gates of Golden Haven, Ramona Stokes

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lodging was top notch. Very quaint and very peaceful. My wife and enjoyed the mineral pool the previous night but the kicker was the treatment the following day. The mud bath was really relaxing. I could feel all of my tension just disappearing instantly. Our massages were absolutely divine! I would recommend strongly Golden Haven to anyone looking for an absolutely awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't STAY there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deeyy
Reviews.Content: I SO wish I'd seen these reviews BEFORE I went. The spa itself is fine (I did the whole mudbath and massage and everyone was OK) but staying there is another issue! An example (yes, in just two nights, this is ONLY an example of the wealth of material they provided me with to illustrate their awful innkeeper skills.....) I was told I could check in early, and I specified around 1:00. When I arrived I was told, no, and that "she shouldn't have said that." Come back around 2:00 and your room will be ready, the other 'she' said. Fine. Lunch and 2:30, here I am. Room? Nope. "oh, she's still cleaning it! These people were like the last to check out....about 15 more minutes. Half an hour later (at 3:00, the "guaranteed" check in time)....not ready. At 3:45 my room was ready. (I'm sorry, I could have cleaned the dang room faster.) An apology? A discount? Bottle of wine? Nod of understanding? ROFL. Nope. Just rude. Even better--when I went to check out two days later I was running a little late and told them I'd be checking out late. After a "discussion" with several people, one of whom was flat out objectionably rude, he finally told me "fine. but you'll have to be out of there right at 12:45." Ahhh....hospitality. NOT.
